short_message: LPG distribution has always been an issue of vital importance both for the people and the government in the country. It is essential to ensure that all
message:
LPG distribution has always been an issue of vital importance both for the people and the government in the country. It is essential to ensure that all the households get the benefits of the government schemes.

A team of researchers from IIT Kharagpur led by Prof. Manoj Kumar Tiwari of the Department of Industrial and Systems Engineering devised a decision support system (DSS) to help in maximizing LPG connections in BPL (below poverty line) households. It is the first of its kind for analysis of national-level energy focused on the Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY).
PMUY, launched in May 2016, which initially aimed to provide five crore LPG connection by 2019 in BPL households, has now been revised to provide eight crore connections by 2020.

The DSS at IIT uses mixed linear programming to mathematically formulate the policy using input parameters, decision variables and their relationships that help in ascertaining proper functioning of the system towards the goal.
The IIT team has done sensitivity analysis with the mathematical model and can predict the number of household connections to be increased and also the critical region that contributes most in each zone of LPG distribution.

Source: https://www.financialexpr...

short_message: IIT Kharagpur students have yet again stamped their authority on the International platform by winning the first Singapore-India Hackathon, a 36-hour competition
message:
IIT Kharagpur students have yet again stamped their authority on the International platform by winning the first Singapore-India Hackathon, a 36-hour competition to develop creative and innovative solutions focused on the theme 'Smart Campus'. Winning team of Pranjal Shankhdhar, Madhav Datt and Anurag Bharadwaj provided a Map Learning and Augmented Reality based solution without using the floor plan or any other kind of input for navigating indoors, thereby taking SGD 10,000 to their home as the winning prize. The demo of their Augmented Reality navigation App 'Skywalker' for users to find their way indoors and outdoors, which can also be integrated with Google Maps can be found here: https://youtu.be/0hwkiIbI...
The hackathon had 20 teams of three university students each from India and Singapore, participating in a 36-hour challenge at Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) from 12th to 14th November. Out of these only 5 teams from each country reached to the finals where they had to pitch their solutions. The other winning teams from India were NIT Trichy, and MIT College of Engineering Pune securing second and third place respectively. Winners were awarded the prizes by Hon'ble Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team for this innovative solution and winning the competition.

short_message: Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya of the Civil Engineering Department has been elected a fellow of the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). ASCE Fellows
message:
Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya of the Civil Engineering Department has been elected a fellow of the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). ASCE Fellows have made celebrated contributions and developed creative solutions that change lives around the world. It is a prestigious honor held by only 3% of the ASCE members.

Professor Baidurya Bhattacharya is an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur of the 1991 batch of Civil Engineering Department. He completed his BTech from IIT Kharagpur and did MS and PhD. in Civil Engineering from Johns Hopkins University, USA. His main areas of research include Computational Materials Science (Nanomechanics) and Probabilistic Mechanics. He has also been the Associate Dean, Alumni Affairs and International Relations and currently is the Dean, International Relations at IIT Kharagpur. Before joining IIT Kharagpur as an Assistant Professor in the year 2006, he has also been an Assistant Professor at the University of Delaware and Visiting Assistant Professor at Stanford University.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for his future endeavors.

short_message: Childhood is an enchanting vista, an era of imagination, an artistic journey, an ode to love and a happy moment.  Memories of childhood are the dreams
message:
Childhood is an enchanting vista, an era of imagination, an artistic journey, an ode to love and a happy moment. Memories of childhood are the dreams that stay with us even when we are awake. Every single day we wish to take a single childhood memory and blow it up into a bubble and live inside it forever.
This day of 14th November 2018, celebrates the 130th birth anniversary of a freedom fighter, a visionary, an architect of modern India and a firm believer in the light of India's future - aptly embodied in his love for children, Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru. It is this love we commemorate today as children's day & his legacy we honor.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Children's Day.

Don't let the child inside you fade away.

short_message: Most of you might remember security guards for making you cycle through the cycle lanes but admittingly, we need to recognise the efforts they put in for
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 19 new photos — with Partha P Chakrabarti and 5 others.
message:
Most of you might remember security guards for making you cycle through the cycle lanes but admittingly, we need to recognise the efforts they put in for our service. There is a lot more to them than what meets the eyes. They are also involved in some initiatives for the betterment of our campus and most recent of them is the cleanliness drive taken under 'Swacch Bharat Mission. Apart from the regular duty assigned to them, they have now voluntarily come together to make the campus cleaner and plastic free.
This cleanliness drive was initiated this October on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti and since then, security guards have been devoting one hour from 4 o'clock to 5 o'clock every Saturday to clean some of the public places in the campus such as Nalanda, Vikramshila complex etc. This initiative of campus cleanliness is planned to be continued for next one year and the schedule for next three months has been already chalked out. This Saturday, they cleaned Technology Guest House premises.
In addition to this, they also conducted a bicycle drive in a nearby village to spread awareness about Gandhiji’s teachings, cleanliness and the effect of drug abuse among the villagers. Cycle Yatra team halted at village Purbapatri and carried out a cleanliness and sanitation drive as part of Swachh Bharat Abhiyan.
The inauguration of this drive on Gandhi Jayanti saw the presence of Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti (Director), Prof. S. K. Bhattacharya (Deputy Director), Prof. Bhrigu Nath Singh (Registrar), Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA), Prof. Sudhirkumar Barai (Dean, UGS), Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG), Mr. S. S. Jha (Head, Security Section) and many others. Cleaning kits were also distributed to the security personnel.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur applauds the voluntary involvement of Security guards contributing towards a cleaner and plastic free campus.

short_message: American comic book writer, creator of Spiderman, and the man whose presence was awaited for in every single Marvel movie, Stan Lee, passed away at an
message:
American comic book writer, creator of Spiderman, and the man whose presence was awaited for in every single Marvel movie, Stan Lee, passed away at an age of 95.

He created a comic revolution which extended beyond the characters and storylines to the way in which comic books engaged the readership and built a sense of community between fans and creators.

A good heart has stopped beating, a good soul ascended to heaven, or maybe to infinity and beyond. Excelsior.

short_message: The Scholars' Avenue met up with Mr. S. S. Jha, Head of The Security Section to inquire about the various measures taken by his team to ensure safe dwelling
message:
The Scholars' Avenue met up with Mr. S. S. Jha, Head of The Security Section to inquire about the various measures taken by his team to ensure safe dwelling in the campus.
Here are the few things about the security section and facilities that are available and that you might have missed.

>How watched are we?
CCTV cameras have been already installed at the gates and the cross sections of campus. The footages will be held with the security section and will be used in cases of thefts and complaints regarding specific incidents. After installations, it has become easier to track down incidents of stolen cycles and it has empowered the security section to direct efforts in the proper direction. Halls and other common areas have already equipped with these cameras and the process of installing more is still going on. So if you're planning on something notorious, now is not the right time.

>What about the vehicle filled KGP?
Almost got crushed by some random speeding car on campus? Serious planning is going on for vehicle tracking and regulating in the campus. Passes are being issued to the vehicle that does not belong to residents of the campus and the validity is reduced to 3 months. Without renewal of the pass, outsiders wouldn't be let in. Given the CCTVs at gates, trespassers better stick to it.

>What if I'm in an emergency? How do I get help?
In what we felt like one of the most useful initiative, The Security Section has formed a Quick Relief Team (QRTs). The security professionals will be strolling the campus all the time to get to you within a few minutes of your call for help.
Save the numbers of QRTs- 03222-281002, 03222-281003

>Are there any special provisions for Women's Safety?
Not yet but on the way. Special QRTs will be made for the safety of girls in the campus. This would imply access to security in girls halls 24*7. This will also mean that female student will be more free and comfortable to contact the security in times of need. The women security professionals will be specially trained to cater to the female population of the campus.

>I don't feel safe due to some individuals on campus. Can I have access to security?
The Security Section Head told us that they consider every case individualistically and try to reach out to students in whatever ways possible. If any student believes that his security is threatened by anyone, he/she can report it to the security section and they will provide whatever assistance necessary if the threat is legitimate.

The Scholars' Avenue will stay in touch with The Security Section to convey the needs of the student community and know about the status of various projects that they have taken up.
We'll be glad to take up suggestions from you.

short_message: Just a couple of days ago, we KGPians celebrated the festival of Diwali in our own traditional way in the form of 'Illumination'. Though each one of them
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
Just a couple of days ago, we KGPians celebrated the festival of Diwali in our own traditional way in the form of 'Illumination'. Though each one of them was a brilliant example of dedication, hard work, and perseverance, some stood out from the others, according to the judges. Many of you might not have got a chance to have a glance at them due to several reasons. So, we at Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur present you the podium-finishing Illuminations along with their theme.

Gold- RP

Eminence, excellence, and intensity of Gangaputra Bhishma was shown from his birth to death-

पितृइच्छा पूर्ति हेतु ली ब्रह्नचर्य की शरण,
हुए गुरुखिलाफ भी, धर्मरक्षा के कारण,
मृतशया पर भी कृष्ण-नाम में लीन,
बलिदान, प्रतिज्ञा, भक्ति के सर्वोत्तम उदाहरण |

Silver- LBS

Rising out from the ashes- Encouraging to rise out from fears and failures and to become a better person forming a healthy legacy that lasts forever just like the Mysore Palace which stood up after a series of destructions turning more magnificent than ever

Bronze- RK

Prahlad's Undying Faith- By recounting the ballad of Narasimha, we narrate the victory of Prahlad's devotion to omnipresent Vishnu over Hiranyakashyapu's worldly desires, revealing the power of faith.

Photos Credits: RK and LBS Illumination- William Mohanty Sir and RP Illumination- Click Kgp

short_message:
Beefed up security on the Campus
In a conversation with Mr. S. S. Jha, Head of the security section, we have got to know about the various measures
message:
Beefed up security on the Campus
In a conversation with Mr. S. S. Jha, Head of the security section, we have got to know about the various measures taken by the security section of IIT Kharagpur to ensure better safety of the students and overall peacefulness on the campus. Some of these measures are:
1) Installation of over a hundred CCTV cameras across the campus including Halls, exit and entry gates, crossover positions like Tikka and many more. This ensures tracking of the happenings on the campus in a better way and enables the security team to spot the situations where emergency measures are needed to be taken. This would help in cases like cycle thefts, inappropriate incidents etc. A proposal of installing extra three times more the CCTV cameras installed right now is underway and is soon to be procured within next one month. Earlier, Awaaz had communicated the need of CCTV cameras in the campus to the authorities based on our survey on Basic Amenities. And we are happy to see this getting implemented.
2) Formation of Quick Response Teams (QRTs). There are 4 sets of QRT teams strolling around campus all the time and students, in case of any emergency, can call them 24 x 7 and they would be there to help you out within two to three minutes. QRT team is equipped with motorbikes and wireless sets. QRTs can be called on two numbers: 03222-281002, 03222-281003
3) Entry Passes for non-IIT students and staffs. Non IIT members now have to take a three month valid entry pass in order to cross through the campus. Once the validity is over, they need to renew the same. Without getting their entry passes checked, they can't go through the gates.
4) More Wireless sets to security personnel. More than four dozens of Wireless sets have been procured and distributed to security personnel to enable effective communication and hence, quicker actions.
5) Proposal of Women Cell. A proposal for having Women QRT teams and more women security personnel is underway.

Besides beefing up the security, they have also been actively involved in smooth conduction of Illumination, Durga Puja celebrations and other events happening in the campus. This, for sure, indicates that the security measures have been strengthen over recent months and we hope that it’s going to get better in future.

short_message:
Results | Illumination and Rangoli 2018
Continuing the distinctive tradition of celebrating Diwali with uniquely weaved 'Illumination' and colourfully
message:
Results | Illumination and Rangoli 2018
Continuing the distinctive tradition of celebrating Diwali with uniquely weaved 'Illumination' and colourfully created 'Rangoli', KGPians have today presented an extraordinary example of relentless effort and perseverance that spanned over the last two months demanding each ounce of blood and sweat from the students. Enormous were the efforts, and so has been the outcome! Not a single pair of eyes were left undazzled with the elegance of Illuminations and Rangolis. Though each and every hall produced best of the Rangolis and Illumination with the collective efforts of boarders, still the results are as follows:

Illumination:
Gold - RP Hall
Silver - LBS Hall
Bronze - RK Hall
Honourable Mention (4th Position) - MS Hall

Rangoli:
Gold - RK Hall
Silver - LBS Hall
Bronze - RP Hall
Honourable Mention (4th Position) - Azad Hall

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning halls and applauds the efforts put in by students to make this celebration successful.

short_message:
To
The Managing Director
Mr. Kshitij Jain
Exide Life Insurance
Bangalore -560001

Sub: Complaint against Exide Life insurance
message:
To
The Managing Director
Mr. Kshitij Jain
Exide Life Insurance
Bangalore -560001

Sub: Complaint against Exide Life insurance for fraudulent activities

Request for Cancellation of policy no: 03747862, 03747894, 03780493 & 03780492

Respected Sir,

This has reference to my above complaint I am sending you mail by explaining in details:

I beg to state that myself Dilip Kumar Dutta (63 years old) is residing at 2/63 Vidyasagar Colony, Naktala, P.S- Netaji Nagar thana, Vidyasagar Colony Bus Stand, Kolkata - 700047 is complaining against Exide Life Insurance and their employee Baburam Mahapatra (BM, Exidelife of Golpark branch, Kolkata).

They cheated me by taking my hard earned money which I got from my retirement benefit. They told me that to take one time(single) policy from Exide Life insurance which would be as like as bank FD and I would get Rs. 24000/- PM as interest. They told me that it could be encash anytime whenever I wish as like as bank FD.

They added that to inform them when I would received my one time policy bond at my residence and that should be kept in their custody/Exide branch without cutting that one time policy/FD bond's envelope to process my interest@24000/-pm.

And as per their advice I had handed over my 4 nos of above one time policy/FD bond (Sealed envelope) to Baburam Mahapatra when I had received it without cutting all envelope.

When I had not received any interest which they had committed to me Rs.24000/-pm since this long time (6 months time) then I discussed with my family and friends regarding their forgery. My family and friends told me that I had been cheated by Baburam Mahapatra and also I come to know that several senior citizens people have been cheated by them.

I requested them several times to return back my all one time policy/FD bond to me but all time they said that my interest@24000/-pm was in process at HO and all my bond were required for it. They also told me that it would take time (4-5 months) initially and I would get accumulated interest (4-5 months) in my bank account and all one time bond all together.

When I shouted them that time Baburam Mahapatra have given me 4 nos of above my policy/FD bond by the first week of previous month and I become faint by seeing of this said bond.

I found that all of above said one time Exide life policy bond(which they said) are recurring policies like LIC which I have to pay for that said term else all policies will be lapsed on 2nd year onwards.
I have not a single paise to pay premium on 2nd year, I had invested all my savings at Exide life Insurance as per Baburam Mahapatra's commitment that I would get interest@24000/- pm.

Policy details are mentioned below:

1.Policy No: 03747862 Rs.: 750000/- for 10 years premium payment term.

2. Policy No: 03747894 Rs: 750000/- for 10 years premium payment term.

3. Policy No: 03780492 Rs: 48000/- for 5 years premium payment term and maturity at 15 years.

4. Policy No: 03780493 Rs. 500000/-for 5 years premium payment term and maturity at 20 years.

Baburam Mahapatra had taken my above amount Rs.:2048000/- which I have earned from my retirement benefit and that i had kept in my bank as FD. He told me that Exide Life has started banking business and people could invest here as bank Fixed deposit (one time) and interest (10-12%) would be credited in my bank account in monthly basis.

I come to know that Baburam Mahapatra is a big culprit and big cheater who are cheating every senior citizens people by sitting at Exide life Golpark branch, Kolkata office day to day. And Exide life insurance are supporting his all fraudulent activities. He can do all this fraudulent activities by getting support from his bosses. They have a good understanding with each other regarding agents/employee's payout which they are taking day to day. This is very very unfortunate that Exide life insurance such a IRDA listed company are recruiting such fraud, cheater people like Baburam Mahapatra and have given such a senior label position like Branch Manager. Every common people like me should trust a Branch Manager of a listed co.

After taking 30 days of time customers care people mailed that they would not cancel my above policies. Mr Joydeep Banerjee called me, i told him that your fraud employee Baburam Mahapatra cheated me by getting support from Exide co. He had taken all bonds (in sealed envelope position) when that i received. And he returned all bonds first week of previous month. I couldn't check their terms and conditions which they are telling now, Baburam Mahapatra intentionally done it, he knew that i must cancel all bonds if i able to see their terms & conditions that time when i received that.

BABURAM MAHAPATRA DIDN'T GIVE ME SCOPE FOR CANCELLATION AT FREE LOOK PERIOD.

I am a retired person (63 years old) & got above all money as retirement benefit and had kept in bank (FD) & was getting interest from bank per month for which I was maintaining my family.

Now I am totally helpless and not have a single paise to buy medicines for me and my wife. We are heart patient and have high blood sugar and high blood pressure.

Without any medical test Exide Life Insurance issued my all policies. They did false medical where as me and my spouse is heart patient. All information in bond are false. This all things happened by Baburam Mahapatra without taking my consent.

I write to request to arrange for cancellation above all policies and kindly refund my money Rs: 2048000/- and obliged.

Yours faithfully,

Dilip Kumar Dutta

short_message: Deepawali, 'a row of lights', a festival celebrated with fervorous gaiety, is the period of time to attain full inner illumination and inexhaustible spiritual
message: Deepawali, 'a row of lights', a festival celebrated with fervorous gaiety, is the period of time to attain full inner illumination and inexhaustible spiritual wealth of the self. As the holy occasion of Diwali is here and the atmosphere is filled with the spirit of mirth and love, it is the right time to enlighten one's understanding with the help of supreme light of lights. Let's lighting up the candles to enjoy life, have decorations to light life and have presents to share success. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone to prosper gloriously on the material as well as spiritual planes and urge everyone to celebrate the festival in the true sense by spreading joy and light up the world of others.

short_message: Considering the risks involved activities during Illumination right from climbing on and swiftly descending from the tables at considerable heights to
message:
Considering the risks involved activities during Illumination right from climbing on and swiftly descending from the tables at considerable heights to put diyas on the chatai including involvement of a lot of oil and fire, we believe that the students' safety should be of foremost importance. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had voiced its concerns with the administration regarding the safety measures as we had an email correspondence with the Gymkhana president and proposed that some concrete guidelines be given to all the halls to be followed apart from some safety and security measures from the institute. The administration was quick to respond and many of our suggestions were incorporated in the recently released security guidelines (attached below).
We had a talk with Prof William Mohanty, president TSG about the same and he agreed that we shall have some safety standards to be followed strictly as the set of rules in the competition, and train some students from the halls beforehand for swift action in case of accidents next year onwards.
Security Advisory Notice: https://erp.iitkgp.ac.in/...

short_message:
The MHRD initiative for 'Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat' will be celebrated for the states of Jharkhand and Goa this weekend.
The celebrations will start
message:
The MHRD initiative for 'Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat' will be celebrated for the states of Jharkhand and Goa this weekend.
The celebrations will start with the food fest which will be having delicacies of both the states. It will be held at Kazi Nazrul Community Centre on 9th of November from 4 pm. The event will be continued on the next day with a Cultural Programme showcasing the cultural heritage of both states. This will be held at Kalidas Auditorium on 10th November from 6 pm.

short_message: Prof. Mrigank Sharad, one of the most celebrated young professors at IIT Kharagpur is often flooded with the questions pertaining to whether the students
message:
Prof. Mrigank Sharad, one of the most celebrated young professors at IIT Kharagpur is often flooded with the questions pertaining to whether the students should go abroad for higher studies, and if yes, one should opt for MS or for PhD during his interaction with students. In the following article, he has aptly explained the intricacies involved in taking decisions for one's future as he concludes, 'The key is NOT to fall for fanciful ideas, which excite you initially, without understanding the BIG Picture and the overall scheme of things. Don't freeze your choices too early during your UG studies. Keep looking, keep listening and keep reading to improve your understanding and maturity level.'
The students are advised to have a look at this article. Please be informed that Prof. Mrigank Sharad has been President of India Gold Medalist at IIT Kharagpur and he wishes to write a series of articles addressing similar issues.
https://www.linkedin.com/...

short_message: Diwali, the festival of light, demarcates the return of Lord Rama and happiness in the lives of the people of Ayodhya. Joy and happiness spread like the
message:
Diwali, the festival of light, demarcates the return of Lord Rama and happiness in the lives of the people of Ayodhya. Joy and happiness spread like the light of diyas as more people join hands to understand each other's misery and help each other out. This Diwali, SARTH has taken an initiative to lend a tint of happiness to the faces of underprivileged children going to an open school in the village of Khesihari by collecting school bags and clothes for them. The collection drive operates via the collection boxes kept at suitable places at every hall of residence. Let us join hands in this initiative and help in giving someone a reason to smile this Diwali.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes them best of luck for their kind initiative

Team Robotix, IIT Kharagpur is expanding. @Robotics’ Enthusiasts
story: Anirudh Roy shared a post to Technology Robotix Society's timeline.
message:
Anirudh Roy shared a post to Technology Robotix Society's timeline.

Team Robotix, IIT Kharagpur is expanding. @Robotics’ Enthusiasts all across the country: Join us today! Technology Robotix Society announces the selection for the post of Robotix Student Executives (RSE) in technical colleges all over India.
RSEs will be our point of contact with the particular college and will aid communication and interaction to encourage robotics activities there. All RSEs receive a certificate from Team Robotix, as well as exclusive Robotix merchandise, certification from Technology Robotix Society, constant contact with robotics experts for any kind of help and advice on robotics, and the tag itself.
If you are passionate about robotics and want your college to shine at Robotix 2019, all that you have to do is fill up an online form.

Click: www.robotix.in/rse/ to be one of the Robotix Student Executives.
The deadline for the application is 1st December ,23:59 hrs.

short_message: As part of the Unity Drive, to mark the occasion of Sardar Patel's 143rd birth anniversary, the boarders of Patel Hall visited an orphanage named 'Ambassador
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.
message: As part of the Unity Drive, to mark the occasion of Sardar Patel's 143rd birth anniversary, the boarders of Patel Hall visited an orphanage named 'Ambassador Child Home' which is a shelter to 61 girls and 32 boys on Saturday. The children presented a small dance performance for the visitors. Some books, notebooks, board games like Ludo, etc were donated by the boarders of Patel Hall. A Blood Donation Camp was also organized in Patel Hall on Sunday, which saw an overwhelming participation of students from all halls of residence. A team from Calcutta National Medical College was invited to conduct the camp. A total of 160 units of blood was donated which is the highest in the last 5 years.

short_message: 'Run for Unity' was organised today morning at Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur around 6.30 AM to mark the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabh
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 21 new photos — with Shivam Gupta and 7 others.
message:
'Run for Unity' was organised today morning at Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur around 6.30 AM to mark the birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabh Bhai Patel. Since 2013, October 31 is celebrated as the ‘Rashtriya Ekta Diwas’ (National Unity Day) to commemorate the legacy of Sardar Patel, who is credited for bringing India's princely states under one flag after independence. The run was organised to pay tribute to the Iron Man of India Vallabhbhai Patel, who was instrumental in keeping India united.
The event saw a good turnout from the students, staffs and faculties. Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG) and other dignitaries were present on the occasion and participated in the run.

short_message: Conducting Inter IIT Sports Meet is a subject of great honor as well as responsibility. As we all know, IIT KGP will be hosting Inter IIT Sports Meet ‘19.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
Conducting Inter IIT Sports Meet is a subject of great honor as well as responsibility. As we all know, IIT KGP will be hosting Inter IIT Sports Meet ‘19. For the very same and to boost the sports infrastructure on the campus, new playgrounds are under construction.
There are 2 basketball and 2 volleyball courts being made in the PAN loop. Also, numerous workers have been employed for renovating Jnan Ghosh Stadium. The construction work was supposed to be over by 24th November but there is a delay and it is now expected to be over within a couple of months and we would be having new playgrounds and renovated Jnan Ghosh Stadium in the next semester.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur believes that this would be a huge boost for the sports' enthusiasts and would go a long way in defining KGP's sports culture.

Note that this is the final call for the students interested in the winter workshop. After this, no more requests shall be entertained.

short_message: As our world becomes ever more complex and stressful, developing our capacity for dynamic balance in our lives, work, and relationships becomes ever more
message:
As our world becomes ever more complex and stressful, developing our capacity for dynamic balance in our lives, work, and relationships becomes ever more vital to understand and embody in our own lives and to model for others whose lives we influence. It is now time when we students and staff realize that institute wellness cannot be brought forth just by certain groups of people but each and every person must need to play their role in it. We need to get out of our comfort zones and mingle with strangers to lend a helping hand to those who depress themselves with loneliness and other thoughts bothering them. We need to stand up for our fellow mates and that is what Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requests from the masses.

Here is the Cartoon Kona from our November 2017 newsletter edition:

short_message: Students of IIT Kharagpur have made us all proud again by securing the third position in TMUxMIT Hackathon 2018, organized at Taipei Medical University
message:
Students of IIT Kharagpur have made us all proud again by securing the third position in TMUxMIT Hackathon 2018, organized at Taipei Medical University Da'an Campus - B2 on Hackathon on October 19 - 21, 2018. The team of Pradeep Poddar (15MT3EP01), Ipsita Praharaj (15AR10022), Akhil Raj (15MA20057) and Ajay Kumar Singh (15MI31021) achieved this feat in this hackathon on Health IoT (HiOT), thereby bagging a cash prize of NT$ 40,000.
Many industry leaders from across the MIT, Harvard, and TMU participated in this Hackathon. Teams were asked to help the doctors and medical students with data modeling and presentation. Teams were provided with data from eICU Philips and MIMIC III.
KGP team secured the third position on the prototype i.e. Maintaining Blood Sugar Level in ICU and were awarded 40KNT$ for the same. They have been further invited for a research project by Dr. Shabbir at TMU. They were invited by Dr. Shabbir Syed-Abdul(Associate Professor, Taipei Medical University) to attend the TMUxMIT Hackathon on the recommendation of Dr. Ram Babu Roy Sir (Assistant Professor, Rajendra Mishra School of Engg. Entrepreneurship, IIT Kharagpur)

Awaaz. IIT Kharagpur congratulates the team on their success!

short_message: Gangireddy Hanimi Reddy, second-year postgraduate student evidently committed suicide yesterday (24th Oct) in his room. The 24-year-old was found hanging
message:
Gangireddy Hanimi Reddy, second-year postgraduate student evidently committed suicide yesterday (24th Oct) in his room. The 24-year-old was found hanging from the ceiling fan by security guards around 7 PM. His body was bent over on a table with a rope hanging his neck from the ceiling. There was a delay before the door was struck down. The ambulance arrived at the scene with doctors and Reddy was confirmed dead by the doctors. Dean of Student Affairs, Hall Wardens, Vice President also arrived soon enough to look into the matter. His body was taken to the hospital for Autopsy.

G H Reddy, son of Gangireddy Venkata Reddy, hailed from Andhra Pradesh. He took admission in IIT Kharagpur in 2017 and was a boarder of MMM Hall since. The Hall community is still recovering from the shock of this news. Further investigation about this matter is going on.

As sad as it might be, this certainly questions amiability of counselling center and several other Institute Wellness drives that started last year.

short_message: After the thrilling response and acceptance to the previous sessions of Talk with the Director, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents its next installment where
message:
After the thrilling response and acceptance to the previous sessions of Talk with the Director, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents its next installment where the director spoke about his most difficult times as a director of an institute (00:00) and about the Medical facilities inside the campus (03:40). After speaking on the medical facilities, he expressed his take on the Open house conducted last year (04:45). After these sensitive topics, the director spoke about the protests regarding fee hikes in the campus (06:48). Followed by this the director gave his views upon students raising their voices on political agendas prevailing in the nation (10:41). Moreover, the Director also talked about whether the visions which were kept in mind while forming the IIT’s, have been executed(13:40). Finally, the director gave an inspiring message to the students(15:33).
Check out the video to find out the views and perspectives of one of the most passionate and impactful persons in our institute!

The Youtube link for the video is here: https://youtu.be/hj1vnrcp...

short_message:
Armed with his knowledge, wit, and artistic flair,
R.K. Laxman did nothing less than unleash himself upon this country. His bold stance and perspectives
message:
Armed with his knowledge, wit, and artistic flair,
R.K. Laxman did nothing less than unleash himself upon this country. His bold stance and perspectives on political underpinnings have been admirable through the years, and undoubtedly enjoyed by all – the young and the old, the lay and the proficient.
R.K. Laxman won numerous awards for his cartoons, including Asia’s top journalism award, the Ramon Magsaysay Award, in 1984.
In 2005, the Government of India honored him with the 'Padma Vibhushan.'
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur pays homage to 'The Common Man' cartoonist on his 97th birth anniversary.

short_message: 'Valmiki Jayanti' is celebrated as the birthday of the famous poet Maharshi Valmiki. It is especially very popular in Northern India and is known as 'Pargat
message:
'Valmiki Jayanti' is celebrated as the birthday of the famous poet Maharshi Valmiki. It is especially very popular in Northern India and is known as 'Pargat Diwas.'
Maharshi Valmiki is also known as 'Adi Kavi' as he discovered the first Sloka which set the base of Sanskrit poetry. Maharshi Valmiki is the author of the famous Hindu epic Ramayana and one of the greatest saints of the ancient world. His complete life and teachings have always encouraged Humans to fight against social injustice. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur remembers Maharishi Valmiki on this auspicious day of 'Valmiki Jayanti.'

short_message: For promoting science and technology in India along with harnessing scientific knowledge for the cause of humanity and national welfare and to promote
message:
For promoting science and technology in India along with harnessing scientific knowledge for the cause of humanity and national welfare and to promote and maintain liaison between Science and Humanities, the Indian National Science Academy Teachers award has been awarded to Prof. Srabani Taraphder from the Department of Chemistry. Her astonishing effort for developing extensive computational methods of studying proton transfer reactions using a wide range of simulation methods including classical and quantum mechanical-molecular mechanical molecular dynamics simulations was recognized by the Academy and thus helped her to get into the list of Awardees.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur extends it’s heartiest Congratulations to Prof Srabani Taraphder for her achievement and getting a price of Rs.50,000.

List of all other Awardees can be found from the following link: http://insaindia.res.in/t...

short_message: In the recent QS Indian University rankings IITs continue to be on the top spots. The QS Indian University rankings include public universities, private
message:
In the recent QS Indian University rankings IITs continue to be on the top spots. The QS Indian University rankings include public universities, private universities and higher education institutions or deemed universities.

A total of 7 IITs secured spots under top 10 in QS Indian university rankings '19.
IIT Bombay secured the top position followed by IISc Bengaluru on the second position. IIT Madras stands on the third position in Indian university rankings. IIT Delhi, which is above IIT Madras in world ranking, stands on the fourth spot in Indian ranking. IIT Kharagpur and IIT Kanpur are interestingly on fifth and sixth spot respectively in Indian University rankings whereas in world rankings IIT Kanpur is above IIT Kharagpur. University of Delhi is at the seventh spot whereas University of Hyderabad is at the eight place. IIT Roorkee, IIT Guwahati, are among other IITs which are under top 10, they stood on the ninth and tenth place respectively.

Twenty Indian institutions received full marks in the staff with PhD, the indicator designed to identify the extent to which institutions are cultivating a highly-qualified faculty body.
Moreover, MIT secured the top rank in QS World University rankings for the seventh consecutive year.

Under the QS University rankings survey the universities are evaluated mainly by this six metrics: Academic reputation, Employer Reputation, Student to faculty ratio, Citations per faculty, International faculty ratio and International student ratio.

Major IITs lacked the International faculty and students aspect of the survey. The citations per faculty aspect of IISc Bengaluru was the best among Indian universities with 100/100 points.

https://indianexpress.com...

short_message: Ahoy everyone! We hope everyone is eagerly waiting for the much sought after Winter Workshop. In order to attend the workshop, the aspirants must take
message:
Ahoy everyone! We hope everyone is eagerly waiting for the much sought after Winter Workshop. In order to attend the workshop, the aspirants must take the winter workshop test, which will have mental aptitude/logical questions, some questions on autonomous robotics (for the autonomous workshop) and some on coding (for the image processing workshop). This test is compulsory for attending the workshop. It is a non-qualifying test, implying that the aspirant will be able to attend the workshop irrespective of the score on the test.

There will be a few questions from the upcoming KRAIG 301 related to Image Processing. Thus, you are highly encouraged to attend the same.

You can visit our website www.robotix.in for more information.

The tentative date for the test: 28th October 2018.

#gear_up

short_message: Great dreamers are those who dream a bit beyond their limits and, usually, they are the ones who can think out of the box. One such dreamer was Dr. A.P.J.
message:
Great dreamers are those who dream a bit beyond their limits and, usually, they are the ones who can think out of the box. One such dreamer was Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, widely renowned as the Missile Man of India, he was honored with the highest civilian award of the country, the Bharat Ratna in the year 1997.

He served as the 11th president of India from 2002 to 2007 and worked as a scientist and science administrator at DRDO and ISRO. Throughout his life, he was intimately involved in India's civilians space programme and military missile development programmes along with Pokhran-II nuclear tests in 1998.
Despite all this, he always preferred to call himself a teacher. Being a visionary, he always envisioned India's potential in its children and youth. He strongly advocated education for all to develop rational and scientific thinking right from the start.

An inspiration to endless people in the country, a true example of simple living and always young at heart. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur remembers Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam on his 87th birth anniversary.

short_message: With profound grief, we bring to you the news of the demise of our beloved Professor Brajbhushan Pandey. He was a well-known Transportation and Highway
message:
With profound grief, we bring to you the news of the demise of our beloved Professor Brajbhushan Pandey. He was a well-known Transportation and Highway Engineer throughout the world.

Prof. Brajbhushan Pandey (retd.) was a 1961 graduate of Civil Engineering from IIT Kharagpur and joined as a faculty here in the year 1964. He served as HoD of the Civil Engineering Department between 1993 and 1996. He had outstanding contributions to the development of both urban and rural road and transportation infrastructure throughout the country at a time when it was in its most crucial stage. As a member of many government schemes and organizations such as National Rural Road Development Agency and the Technical committee of Indian Roads Congress to say a few, he helped pave the path to better roads in the country and development of state of the art equipment for testing of road and road materials. He received many accolades from various scientific and government organizations for outstanding research contributions and was honored with the Distinguish Alumnus Award of IIT Kharagpur in 2011.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur extends its deepest condolences to family and friends of the Professor along with the entire KGP community. We hope that his contributions will be remembered and built upon.

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur had a phenomenal start to their Inter IIT campaign this year as they finished second in swimming garnering 47 points.
IIT Madras topped
message:
IIT Kharagpur had a phenomenal start to their Inter IIT campaign this year as they finished second in swimming garnering 47 points.
IIT Madras topped the points chart with 53 points while IIT Kanpur ended a distant third at 21 points. IIT Bombay stood fourth with 20 points. A total of 6 IIT's opened their account in points table out of 11 participants.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and hopes that this performance in water sports would be carried forward in other sports as well.

message:
Right from the beginning, Men's Water Polo team was buckled-up to play on fiddle, and this picture became more evident when it was the time for the final four. The team displayed a flawless show to destroy the opponent teams, thus resulting in five successive wins and topped the chart with 15 points. In the process, the team handed over a perfect mauling to whatever that came in between them and the trophy.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the entire Water Polo team on their splendid performance.

short_message: After a phenomenal performance of IIT Kharagpur at the inter IIT aquatics meet held in IIT Guwahati where IIT Kharagpur stood second in the points table,
message:
After a phenomenal performance of IIT Kharagpur at the inter IIT aquatics meet held in IIT Guwahati where IIT Kharagpur stood second in the points table, another achievement was unlocked when IIT KGP showcased its talent and proved its mettle in Udghosh, the annual sports meet organized by IIT Kanpur from 4th-7th October. Udghosh proved to be an excellent stage for showcasing IIT KGP’s sporting spirit and gave a slingshot in boosting the confidence of the teams for the upcoming Inter IIT Sports Meet to be held in IIT Guwahati.

The medal-winning teams of IIT KGP in Udghosh 2018-19 are as follows:
1. Chess - Gold medal
2. Badminton Women's- Silver medal
3. Basketball Men's- Silver medal
4. Lawn Tennis Men's- Silver medal
5. Lawn Tennis Women’s- Silver medal
6. Hockey- Bronze medal
7. Squash- Bronze medal
8. Weightlifting- Bronze medal

We wish that both, the beautiful form of KGP’s sportspersons and the winning streak continues.
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the participants and wishes them great luck for Inter IIT Sports meet 2018-19.
#KGPKaTempoHighHai

short_message: In order to facilitate cooperation in research and education between the two institutes, an MoU has been signed between IIT Kharagpur and Norwegian University
message:
In order to facilitate cooperation in research and education between the two institutes, an MoU has been signed between IIT Kharagpur and Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU). This would act as bliss for both the institutions as both the institutions are having trans-disciplinary academic and research programs encompassing science, technology, medicine, social sciences, arts and fine arts. The key areas of focus under this MoU will be Hydro Power, Ocean Modelling, Deep Sea Resources and Marine Technology in which the NTNU has an expertise.

Source: https://www.ndtv.com/educ...

short_message: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Prof. Surjya K Pal (Department of Mechanical Engineering) for being appointed as the new Associate Dean Of Alumni Affairs.
message:
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates Prof. Surjya K Pal (Department of Mechanical Engineering) for being appointed as the new Associate Dean Of Alumni Affairs. We wish him to take the alumni relationships to new heights under their guidance. He did his B.E from Government Engineering College, Jalpaiguri, WB (1st Class, 3rd Rank) and did his masters and Ph.D. from IIT Kanpur and IIT Kharagpur respectively.

Prof Surjya K. Paul has held the following responsibilities in the past :
• Prof-in-Charge, DHI Centre of Excellence on Advanced Manufacturing Technology
• Chairman, Steel Technology Centre
• Chairman, H.M.C

short_message: Technology Students’ Gymkhana, in association with Counselling centre and Institute Wellness Group, conducted a march on the global Mental Health Day.
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message:
Technology Students’ Gymkhana, in association with Counselling centre and Institute Wellness Group, conducted a march on the global Mental Health Day.

Student’s gathered in the Gymkhana were addressed by the Dean of Student Affairs who stressed on the need for awareness and acceptance in the campus. Everyone present took a Mental health pledge and strived to be more forthcoming and instill hope in whichever way possible. Student’s also made promises like being more open to family and friends and interacting with more people.

Although, the 2.2 couldn’t be covered due to rains, people did volunteer for a small march to and from the Main Building. They carried placards and voiced out their support for Mental Health for all and against the stigma that surrounds it.

This march was aimed at removing stigma associated with mental health and spreading awareness for the end of this discrimination. In a way, it did just that, and we hope in the future this emerges to make each and everyone in the campus comfortable to come forth with their issues without fear of judgement or mistreatment. Let us all strive to make Kgp a better place!

short_message:
Attention Final Year Students!
The placement season is set to arrive again as the sweet winter breeze of early mornings and late nights has started
message:
Attention Final Year Students!
The placement season is set to arrive again as the sweet winter breeze of early mornings and late nights has started to flow. The weeklong DP holidays acting as the silence before the bustle of placement season. Alongwith this bustle comes a lot of confusion in the mind of students including whom to contact, what documents do you need, what are the procedures in case of multiple shortlisting and many others. Well, this ain't confusing you much but for the placement season ahead, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has taken the initiative to clear all types of doubts amongst the students regarding placement processes that remain unanswered. Ask any of your doubts and we will get you all the answers right from the desk of CDC PlaceComs and Staff. Your doubt maybe the doubt of many people and even if it is not, it may help generate greater clarity regarding placement processes. We encourage all the Final Year Students to write freely all their queries in the attached form and contribute to an environment of greater lucidity during the high time.
All the Best!

https://goo.gl/forms/Rh8n...

short_message: Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur and Professor, Department of Computer Science & Engineering is being awarded Technology Excellence Award
message:
Prof. Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur and Professor, Department of Computer Science & Engineering is being awarded Technology Excellence Award by Intel India. He joined the institute as a faculty member in 1988. His areas of interest include AI, CAD for VLSI, Embedded Systems, Algorithm Design, and Reliable & Fault-Tolerant Systems. He is also an awardee of Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize for Science and Technology, one of the highest multidisciplinary science award in India, for the engineering category in 2000 and President of India Gold Medal in 1985.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes our professor all the best in his future endeavours!

short_message: Mental well-being, a combination of emotional, psychological, and social well-being, plays a very important role along with physical fitness. Students
message: Mental well-being, a combination of emotional, psychological, and social well-being, plays a very important role along with physical fitness. Students often go through a lot of stress throughout their college life. It is, however, important to keep moving ahead in life and face all the obstacles encountered with optimism. As it is rightly said, your present circumstances don’t determine where you go, they merely determine where you start. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes for the good mental health of the entire KGP Family.

short_message: Do you find your mess messy or canteens a bit unregulated? Be it in terms of food quality, or hygiene, or occasional crowding (of students, cats, and dogs),
message:
Do you find your mess messy or canteens a bit unregulated? Be it in terms of food quality, or hygiene, or occasional crowding (of students, cats, and dogs), or timings, everybody has a lot to say (or rant?) about his/her hall's mess. Here we are, with a survey specifically designed to address the issues pertaining to the mess as well the canteens, and their monitoring. This survey will play a very important role in bringing forth the problems faced by the students into the light of the administration and relevant monitoring committees so that they could take appropriate steps. Critical analysis of the issues as important as mess and canteens is impossible without the opinion of the student community, hence Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur earnestly requests each and every student to invest a little time for the benefit of everyone.
https://goo.gl/forms/Z9rV...

short_message:
7th Inter IIT Tech Meet

The Inter IIT Tech Meet will be held from 18th December 2018 to 20th December 2018 at IIT Bombay. The problem statements
message:
7th Inter IIT Tech Meet

The Inter IIT Tech Meet will be held from 18th December 2018 to 20th December 2018 at IIT Bombay. The problem statements for the events have been released and can be found at http://inter-iit.tech/
Please go through the problem statements, people with relevant experience(s) can apply by sending in their applications (CV and Cover Letter- concisely containing their potential contributions and experiences- along with the valid proofs) at tech.gymkhana@gmail.com
The subject of the email should be [Event Name] [Name] [Roll Number].
Deadline: 13th October 2018, 11:59pm

Note:
- One student can apply in at most 3 events, and they should mention the priority order in the body of each of the emails of the events they are applying to.
- Please attach the valid proofs in a single zip file.
- Please keep the cover letter concise and to-the-point, mentioning your relevant skills and potential contributions you can make.
- Since the Tech Meet is being held in December, the selected people might have to stay in campus in December based on the preparation required for the event.

short_message:
IIT Kharagpur wins Gold in Water Polo at the 34th Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet!

Dominating throughout the tournament, the IIT KGP men's Water Polo
message:
IIT Kharagpur wins Gold in Water Polo at the 34th Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet!

Dominating throughout the tournament, the IIT KGP men's Water Polo team on Sunday defeated arch-rivals IIT Kanpur by 10-6 in the finals of Inter IIT water polo Championship to lift the cup.
Before in the championship, IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Bombay by 13-2, IIT Delhi by 17-2, and IIT Madras by 6-3 in the pool stage, after which it knocked out the hosts IIT Guwahati by 13-2 in the Semi-Finals.

Amlan Shil, Captain of IIT KGP Men's Water Polo Team wins the Best Water Polo Player Award.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the whole KGPian community on this Achievement.

Dominating throughout the tournament, the IIT KGP men's Water Polo
message:
IIT Kharagpur wins Gold in Water Polo at the 34th Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet!

Dominating throughout the tournament, the IIT KGP men's Water Polo team on Sunday defeated arch-rivals IIT Kanpur by 9-6 in the finals of Inter IIT water polo Championship to lift the cup.
Before in the championship, IIT Kharagpur defeated IIT Bombay by 13-2, IIT Delhi by 17-2, and IIT Madras by 6-3 in the pool stage, after which it knocked out the hosts IIT Guwahati by 13-2 in the Semi-Finals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the whole KGPian community on the Championship which has come home.

short_message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Ambar - IIT Kharagpur's post.

“The Vagina Monologues” is a historic feminist play
story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Ambar - IIT Kharagpur's post.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Ambar - IIT Kharagpur's post.

“The Vagina Monologues” is a historic feminist play by Eve Ensler, which was first performed in 1996. The play explores consensual and nonconsensual sexual experiences, body image, genital mutilation, direct and indirect encounters with reproduction, fear, shame, ecstasy, and several other topics through the eyes of women with various ages, races, sexualities, and other differences.

The performers are women from all age groups, ‘societies’ and fields of studies - who have come together to speak out.

The play is an hour long. Hope to see you on Sunday, 9 PM at the Netaji Auditorium!

short_message:
Talk with the Director | Part-1
We had our expectations, and he had his challenges, but among these, there stood a man who has served the Institute
message:
Talk with the Director | Part-1
We had our expectations, and he had his challenges, but among these, there stood a man who has served the Institute for more than 37 years as a student, professor and currently as the Director. Professor Partha P Chakrabarti, famously called as ‘PPC’ among the students, has his style of leadership. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur had the opportunity to have a chat with the Director IIT Kharagpur on all the issues relevant to the institute which directly and indirectly affect the KGP fraternity. In this video interview, he talks about the responsibilities of being a Director (0:00), the difficulties of handling such a large mass of the population in the campus (1:31), the difference between the student communities of our time as compared to that of his (3:40) and what spurred such change in the mindset of students (7:01) which was finally followed by the agendas he had for the institute and to what extent were these executed (8:30). Check out the video to find out the views and perspectives of one of the most passionate and impactful people in our institute!

short_message:
Data Enthusiasts, there?
Self-Driving Cars generate a plethora of data. According to Intel, autonomous vehicles will create 4TB of raw data in a single
message:
Data Enthusiasts, there?
Self-Driving Cars generate a plethora of data. According to Intel, autonomous vehicles will create 4TB of raw data in a single day. Bring 2,500 vehicles on the road, and you quickly generate a Petabyte of data each day. Also, have you ever tried searching through Petabytes of data?

Video Credits: Nuro

short_message: 'There are heroes amongst us, seemingly ordinary people with extraordinary stories. Those who have overcome the odds by making the hard things easy. Of
message:
'There are heroes amongst us, seemingly ordinary people with extraordinary stories. Those who have overcome the odds by making the hard things easy. Of course, they have felt fear and have had moments of self-doubt. But when they have felt like quitting, they have found the support to carry on because this is what real heroes do. They turn weaknesses into strengths and that is why for these heroes, life is invincible.'

Written by Yash Chandak and edited by Vanchhit Rai, here is a real story of relentless struggles, survival, and acceptance of one of our fellow KGPians which will make you question the substantiality of the problems in your life. It requires some patience to read through but the story is definitely worth it.
Give this a read:
http://www.gymkhana.iitkg...

short_message:
Hey Freshers!

Here's the component list for the Hardware Hackathon for Line Following Robot to be held on 8/9th October. Do get the components
message:
Hey Freshers!

Here's the component list for the Hardware Hackathon for Line Following Robot to be held on 8/9th October. Do get the components at the earliest from Bots and chips (Prem Bazaar) or Chaudhary(Tech M)

1. IC7805 Voltage Regulator - 1
2. L293D Motor Driver - 1
3. IR Module - 2
4. 200rpm DC Motor - 2
5. Battery 9v-12v - 1
6. PCB - 1
7. Chasis - 1
8. Castor wheel - 1
9. Wheels - 2
10. Battery connector - 1
11. Solder iron - 1
12. Solder wire - 1
13. IC Bed for L293D - 1
14. Jumpers (male to female) - 6
15. 2 Pin relimate - 3

Do register your team before coming-
https://goo.gl/forms/mkOS...

Note- You may use the same chassis and motors used for robosoccer.

short_message: If you want to collaborate on projects with others, the knowledge of a Version Control System is a must. To help you get started with collaborative development
message:
If you want to collaborate on projects with others, the knowledge of a Version Control System is a must. To help you get started with collaborative development and Open Source, Kharagpur Open Source Society is conducting a workshop on Git and Github.

Time: 2 PM
Venue: NC 231
Date: 7th October 2018 (Sunday)

Please register at http://bit.ly/kossgit
This will help us in sending you resources after the workshop.

In this workshop, we will teach you the basics of Git as a version control software, and we will tell you how to actually contribute to projects on Github. There will be a hands-on session too, where you will learn actually to contribute to real software.

Note for Windows users: Please install Git Bash before coming to the workshop.

Download link (for Windows users only): https://github.com/git-fo...

People who want to take part in Hactoberfest and don't know where to begin, this is your golden choice.
Also if you aspire to take part in the upcoming Kharagpur Winter of Code in December or other programs like Google Summer of Code / Rails Girls Summer of Code/Outreachy the knowledge of Git and GitHub will be crucial.

short_message: AI is quite ubiquitous in today's life and having knowledge of the same is understandably necessary. CodeClub, Department Society of Computer Science and
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message:
AI is quite ubiquitous in today's life and having knowledge of the same is understandably necessary. CodeClub, Department Society of Computer Science and Engg. , is pleased to organize up.AI Summit, a programme open to all, aimed at introducing beginners to the field of AI and reducing the complexity of the topic.
The 3-day programme will involve a Bootcamp, talks by eminent personalities and leaders in the field from companies such as Wadhwani AI, Capillary, Jio etc. and a contest with exciting prizes and goodies to win.
The last part of the summit is a 3-month challenge where students structure real-life problems in the specific domains - industry, education, healthcare, and environment/agriculture and find a solution to those problems. Top 10 teams get the chance to be incubated by big tech companies and the top 3 out of them get cash prizes.
Join them on 5th, 6th and 7th Oct and be a part of the ever-growing AI community.
Stay tuned to page (https://www.facebook.com/upaisummit) and website (upai-summit.in) for updates.

Don't forget to take your friends along with you. Spread the word! Open Source FTW!
Happy Hacking.

short_message: Today marks the 150th birth anniversary of a man, whose arrival blessed the soil of India, and took us on a path of enlightenment. He taught us self-reliance
message:
Today marks the 150th birth anniversary of a man, whose arrival blessed the soil of India, and took us on a path of enlightenment. He taught us self-reliance by spinning khadi, gave this world the noble idea of 'Ahinsa' and led India's independence movement against the British. Mahatma Gandhi is the ambassador of world peace and harmony, and continues to be the inspiration for millions of people across the world. Whole world celebrates this day as International Non-violence day in his honour.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur salutes the father of the nation and wishes you all a Happy Gandhi Jayanti.

short_message: 'IIT did not admit girls while we were there. The only young women to be seen were the daughters of staff members, who were strictly out of bounds. Some
message:
'IIT did not admit girls while we were there. The only young women to be seen were the daughters of staff members, who were strictly out of bounds. Some desperate students of us indulged in a mild flirtation with the tribal girls who came to collect firewood.'
Captain Mohan Ram I.N (Retd.), class of 1958 from IIT Kharagpur and VP, TSG for session 1957-58, continues to write about his wonderful time, in the second part of his beautifully long and detailed account, under the series- 'Reminiscing about the good old days!'. Give this second part a full read here: http://www.gymkhana.iitkg...
The first part of the write-up may be found here: http://www.gymkhana.iitkg...

message: After a not-so-brief lull in activity, we at The Scholar's Avenue decided we needed some inspiration for our next pet project. And since we refuse to take anything seriously, we present to you 'The Garlic', the fake newspaper of IIT KGP.

short_message: The Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO) announced the DRDO Robotics and Unmanned System Exposition for Defence (DRUSE) programme to harness
message:
The Defence Research and Development Organization (DRDO) announced the DRDO Robotics and Unmanned System Exposition for Defence (DRUSE) programme to harness the multifaceted talent available in the country on robotics and unmanned systems.

A Statista report pegs the robotics market to touch almost $500 billion globally in 2025—both consumer and industrial segments. According to a MarketsandMarkets report, the unmanned ground vehicle (UGV) market is projected to grow from $1.49 billion in 2016 to $2.63 billion by 2021 and the unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) market, valued at $18.14 billion in 2017 and projected to reach $52.30 billion by 2025.

AGV Research Group, IIT Kharagpur admires the efforts of DRDO and aspires to build India's first self-driving car and at the same time involved in the research work related to autonomous and mobile robots involving deep learning and reinforcement agents.

Source: https://www.livemint.com/...

short_message: Having a UNIX like OS is crucial for every programmer. We are organizing an Ubuntu Install Fest, an opportunity to get Linux installed on your PC if you
message:
Having a UNIX like OS is crucial for every programmer. We are organizing an Ubuntu Install Fest, an opportunity to get Linux installed on your PC if you have not already done it.

Date: 2nd October 2018
Time: 2 PM to 6PM
Venue: Room F236, Main Building

Bring out the open source geek in you by switching to Linux as a standalone OS, or get it dual booted alongside Windows.

Note: Please download a copy of Ubuntu 18.04 LTS ( https://www.ubuntu.com/do... ). Backup all your important files and don't forget to bring a Pen Drive along with your laptop. Ensure there is around 100 GB free space on your PC. Make sure your laptop is fully charged for the installation to complete smoothly.
Dual boot instructions: https://wiki.metakgp.org/...
PS: If you can't download Ubuntu or bring a pen drive with you, just come with your laptop, we'll have a few spare pen drives.

short_message:
Hey, 1st and 2nd years!

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in
message:
Hey, 1st and 2nd years!

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases so that students who are attending the EAA camps in the first week of December can attend the second phase. Those who are interested in both autonomous robotics and image processing can attend both the phases.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 30th November to 6th December
Phase 2: 8th December to 14th December

short_message: The initiative of screening live matches and events got off to a great start as the enthusiastic cricket fans turned up in large numbers for the Asia Cup
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
The initiative of screening live matches and events got off to a great start as the enthusiastic cricket fans turned up in large numbers for the Asia Cup Final between India and Bangladesh, screened at Netaji Auditorium. A nail-biting finish with India just managing to get over the line served as icing on the cake for the fans. The enthusiasm and intensity of the audience in Netaji Auditorium were no less than the ones sitting in the stadium itself. Everyone cheered their hearts out for our team and celebrated the victory in unison. Initially, when Bangladesh came to bat, the auditorium was sparsely filled but as their innings progressed, the crowd started building up and when India started their chase, the auditorium was fully occupied in no time.
The initiative was one of the proposals of Vaibhav Khatwani, current General Secretary, Social and Cultural, and he was extremely positive of the overwhelming response from the student community and support from Devang Upadhyay, Secretary Films and Prof. Amreesh Chandra, Vice-Chairman, TFS and other concerned stakeholders. Although this screening was conducted by an external vendor this time, Technology Film Society is expected to carry out the same with its own budget for future screenings.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates this initiative to bring out the work-life balance in our campus and hopes to witness more such screenings in the future!

short_message: After the Mid-Semester exams were over, KGP saw the graceful presence of the fifth Indian chess Grandmaster Mr. Surya Shekhar Ganguly on its campus. He
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 24 new photos — with Saurabh Desai and Aditya Meshram.
message:
After the Mid-Semester exams were over, KGP saw the graceful presence of the fifth Indian chess Grandmaster Mr. Surya Shekhar Ganguly on its campus. He enlightened the students with his vast repertoire of experiences regarding chess and various related tournaments. He was an International Master at 16 and a Grandmaster at 19. He was also the 2009 Asian champion and six-time Indian Champion. He shared his real-life incidents on the way to becoming one India's most celebrated chess player and his encounters with the greats in the chess including five-time World Chess Champion Vishwanathan Anand. With his witty and humorous answers, he shared his wisdom about the career in chess and the need to begin early at the age of 4-5 to perform well at a good platform soon. The students had an active participation with many questions towards the end. This fruitful and interactive session was organized and conducted smoothly by the Sports and Games Committee, IIT Kharagpur. Also, Chess Club IIT Kharagpur presented a poem at the end of the session.
Dignitaries present in the session included Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA) and Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG)
Picture credits: Hemanth Addada

The students had an active participation with many questions towards the end. The session was fruitful and interactive. Also, Chess Club IIT Kharagpur presented a poem at the end of the session.
Dignitaries present in the session included Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA) and Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG)
Picture credits: Chess club, IIT Kharagpur

short_message: After the Mid-Semester exams were over, KGP saw the graceful presence of the fifth Indian chess Grandmaster Mr. Surya Shekhar Ganguly on its campus. He
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 24 new photos.
message:
After the Mid-Semester exams were over, KGP saw the graceful presence of the fifth Indian chess Grandmaster Mr. Surya Shekhar Ganguly on its campus. He enlightened the students with his vast repertoire of experiences regarding chess and various related tournaments. He was an International Master at 16 and a Grandmaster at 19. He was also the 2009 Asian champion and six-time Indian Champion. He shared his real-life incidents on the way to becoming one India's most celebrated chess player and his encounters with the greats in the chess including five-time World Chess Champion Vishwanathan Anand. With his witty and humorous answers, he shared his wisdom about the career in chess and the need to begin early at the age of 4-5 to perform well at a good platform soon. The students had an active participation with many questions towards the end. The session was fruitful and interactive. Also, Chess Club IIT Kharagpur presented a poem at the end of the session.
Dignitaries present in the session included Prof. Somesh Kumar (Dean, SA) and Prof. William Mohanty (President, TSG)
Picture credits: Chess club, IIT Kharagpur

short_message: Post Office Passport Seva Kendra (POPSK) was inaugurated today, September 27, 2018 at the Technology Mukhya Dakghar. It was inaugurated by Honourable MLA,
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 4 new photos.
message:
Post Office Passport Seva Kendra (POPSK) was inaugurated today, September 27, 2018 at the Technology Mukhya Dakghar. It was inaugurated by Honourable MLA, Shri. Dilip Ghosh, Kharagpur Sadar. Started with the motive to reduce the hardships faced by the people, the portal was opened for 10 applicants today which will be increased to 30 from September 28, 2018. However, the limit can be extended on demand in future, as told by Regional Passport Officer, Shri. Bibhuti Bhushan Kumar. Appointments will be released on POPSK website www.passportindia.gov.in .

Applicants are supposed to bring online Application Reference Number (ARN) sheets along with other necessary documents of identity proof, address and proof of date of birth with them. The applicants have to pay the passport fees through online payments system.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur considers this as a landmark step and hopes that it will benefit all the faculty and student community in future.

TSG invites applications for Cup-wise CAPTAINS for Inter IIT Cultural Meet 2018 at IIT Roorkee from 27-30th December.

The avenues for application
message:
TSG invites applications for Cup-wise CAPTAINS for Inter IIT Cultural Meet 2018 at IIT Roorkee from 27-30th December.

The avenues for application are:

Dance

Dramatics

Film & Media

Fine-arts & Design

Literary and Speaking Arts

Music

Quizzing

Deadline: 30th September 2018, 11:59 PM

Eligibility: Minimum 2 years of study in KGP except students appearing for campus placements.

Application Format:

Mail subject- [Avenue Name] Captain application [Your Name]

CV mentioning- Personal Details including Year, Positions of responsibility, GC+Competitive Fests participation. (Extremely brief with minimal descriptions attached in a word/pdf document)

Proposals- A minimum 200 word proposal on how to secure medals in events under your application genre, progressively building up on last year’s experience. Dramatics applicants are to specifically mention potential scripts for Stage Play and topics for Nukkad. (Attached as word/pdf file)

Applications without proposals will NOT be considered. Kindly adhere to prescribed format.

All the applications should be emailed to tsg.socult@gmail.com.

short_message: September 6th, 2018 will go down in history as the single most important step towards making our Society even more inclusive, which upholds the ethos of
message:
September 6th, 2018 will go down in history as the single most important step towards making our Society even more inclusive, which upholds the ethos of our beautiful culture- valuing and embracing diversity; though this is just the beginning. Athrey Ranjith Krishnanunni and Monidipa Sengupta of Ambar - IIT Kharagpur explore the significance of and the timeline leading to this historic decision, which wouldn't have been possible without the support, hard work and struggle of the people of this beautiful country, which incidentally also involved several IITians and KGPians. We can't also ignore the fact (though it is of course almost a coincidence) that such a historic verdict was given just the day following Freddie Mercury's 72nd Birthday. As the lead singer of Queen, he was a proud homosexual and unarguably among the most famous Persons of Indian Origin(PIO). As he rightly said: '.....
Don't stop me now 'Cause I'm having a good time
Don't stop me now Yes I'm havin' a good time
I don't want to stop at all...'
Full read: http://www.gymkhana.iitkg...

If you too want to submit your article for Gymkhana blog, visit the blog and click on the 'Publish Your Blog' at the right margin of the webpage. (or visit: http://www.gymkhana.iitkg... )

short_message:
साहित्य के सितारे ।। भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र

भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र को आधुनिक हिंदी के पितामह के नाम से जाना जाता है। हिंदी साहित्य में आधुनिक काल
message:
साहित्य के सितारे ।। भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र

भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र को आधुनिक हिंदी के पितामह के नाम से जाना जाता है। हिंदी साहित्य में आधुनिक काल का आगमन भारतेंदु हरिश्चंद्र के काल से ही माना जाता है। इनका मूल नाम 'हरिश्चंद्र' था, इन्हें 'भारतेंदु ' की उपाधि दी गयी थी। उन्होंने देश में व्याप्त गरीबी, पराधीनता व अमानवीय शोषण को ही अपने साहित्य का लक्ष्य बनाया। हिन्दी को राष्ट्र भाषा का दर्जा दिलवाने में उन्होंने अपनी प्रतिभा का बखूबी इस्तेमाल किया। हिन्दी काव्य व पत्रकारिता के क्षेत्र में उनका अमूल्य योगदान रहा। हरिश्चंद्र बाबू का व्यक्तित्व और कृतित्व बहुआयामी था। उन्होंने आधुनिक हिंदी साहित्य की लगभग सभी विधाओं में योगदान दिया विशेषकर गद्य साहित्य में। हिंदी में नाटकों का प्रारम्भ भारतेन्दु हरिश्चंद्र से माना जाता है और इसकी शुरुआत बंगला के विद्यासुन्दर (1867) नाटक के अनुवाद से होती है। उन्होंने 'हरिश्चंद्र चन्द्रिका', 'कविवचन सुधा' और 'बाला बोधिनी' पत्रिकाओं का संपादन भी किया। वे एक उत्कृष्ट कवि, सशक्त व्यंग्यकार, सफल नाटककार, जागरूक पत्रकार तथा ओजस्वी गद्यकार थे। इसके अलावा वे लेखक, कवि, संपादक, निबंधकार, एवं कुशल वक्ता भी थे। उन्होंने मात्र चौंतीस वर्ष की आयु में एक विशाल साहित्य की रचना की।

अपनी इन्हीं विशेषताओं के कारण भारतेंदु हिन्दी साहित्याकाश के एक दैदिप्यमान नक्षत्र बन गए और उनका युग भारतेंदु युग के नाम से प्रसिद्ध हुआ।
