short_message: Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This
message: Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This time, it’s the Team Infinity from IIT Kharagpur which bagged the third prize in the Innovation Summit Bold Ideas Competition at Paris organized by Schneider Electric, one of the biggest players in the field of renewable energy. The team consisting of Nawazish Parwez, Nihal Gupta, Soumya Dubey, Akash Kumar and Gaurav Kumar (right to left in photograph) performed exceptionally well in the first round of the competition that saw a participation of more than 240 teams from 40+ countries all around the world to secure a place among the top 10 teams to showcase their talent in the summit to be held in Paris. Their idea was based on the hybrid solar panel which increases the efficiency of the existing conventional system, using the modern principles of Materials and Environmental Engineering. The idea was appreciated by the judging panel consisting of environmentalists and scientists all around the globe.

short_message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Final Standings

This edition of General Championship saw spectacular participation from various halls of residence
message:
General Championship 2017-18 || Final Standings

This edition of General Championship saw spectacular participation from various halls of residence in an extravaganza of various sports, cultural and technology events. The zeal and enthusiasm of the participants were striking during the events and so was during the award ceremony held on April 13, 2018, in the Kalidas Auditorium. Though each and every hall tried the best of them, a handful of them excelled and received the much-desired trophies and cups in an aura filled with the tempo-shouts and bliss.

The final standings of each General Championship are as follows:

||General Championship Social & Cultural||

The battle for the trophy went up to the last event and the competition between RK and Patel ultimately ended up in favour of RK. Both RK and Patel conquered over the cups in 4 categories.
1. RK (913.3 Points)
2. Patel (888.3 Points)
3. Azad (545 Points)

Dramatics Cup - RK
Fine-arts Cup - RK
Entertainment Cup - Patel
Literary Cup - Patel

||General Championship Sports & Games||
1. Azad (70 Points)
2. MMM (42 Points)
3. LBS (36 Points)

||General Championship Technology||
1. LBS (420 Points)
2. Azad (335 Points)
3. RP (330 Points)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and appreciates the participants for putting their efforts. For further details and event wise points distribution, follow the link: http://awaaziitkgp.org/GC...

short_message: Recently, one of our fellow students, Mr. Nanda Kishore, a fifth-year student from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering
message:
Recently, one of our fellow students, Mr. Nanda Kishore, a fifth-year student from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering succumbed to a multiorgan failure in a hospital in Kolkata. The sad demise took place owing to tuberculosis which was identified during his operation of appendicitis there. Though the first operation was successful, he could not recover and died after continuously struggling for 21 days.

The Senate along with the faculty members from Administration, being concerned about the poor financially state of his family, have decided to raise a fund of INR 300000 including the expenses for his treatment to help them sustain for a year and find a stable option with time.

Here is the link to the fundraiser for Mr. Nanda Kishore: https://www.ketto.org/fun...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students’ community to help the family of Mr. Nanda Kishore to the best of their capability and prays for the departed soul to rest in peace.

short_message:
||New Course on Functional Materials & Devices||

Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur commences a new course namely ‘M.Tech. in Functional
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur with Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur.
message:
||New Course on Functional Materials & Devices||

Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur commences a new course namely ‘M.Tech. in Functional Materials & Devices’ which replaces the earlier Solid State Technology (M.Tech.) course from the very next academic session.

The newly introduced course structure comprising of a good range of interdisciplinary courses from Dept. of E & ECE, Materials Science Centre, etc. aims to produce a better workforce which can tackle the modern challenges in industries. Apart from the elemental constituents, courses on Computational Methods, Science & Technology of Nanomaterials and Advanced Experiments in Solid State Technology are also included in the curriculum.

With a total of 25 seats, applications are invited from the students of Applied Electronics & Instrumentation, Applied Electronics Engg., Electronic Instrumentation & Control, Electrical & Electronics Engg., Electronics Engg.- Design & Manufacturing, Engineering Physics, Physics/Applied Physics and Material Science & Engineering.

The applicants with following qualifying degree can apply for the same:
1. B.E./B.Tech. or Equivalent
2. M.Sc. (With Mathematics both at +2 and B.Sc. level)
The deadline for online application for submission is April 18, 2018 (Wednesday).

short_message: It has come to our notice that the marking scheme in the Inter Hall Hardware Modeling event did not occur as per the standards set by the Tech GC rulebook.
message:
It has come to our notice that the marking scheme in the Inter Hall Hardware Modeling event did not occur as per the standards set by the Tech GC rulebook.
According to the official rules, the median normalization must be applied to the total scores of each judge following which the now normalized scores of every judge are added to obtain the final standings. However, the General Secretary's calculations led to the normalization of each individual parameter of every judge, which then resulted in incorrect standings.

A few students have mailed Prof William K Mohanty requesting that he consider their case and have the renormalized scores as per the official rules decide the final results. We hope that the final ruling abides by the norms.

With the gymkhana awards being scheduled to be presented today, even though logistical issues are posing a hindrance to a correction in the judgement, we wanted to let everyone be aware of the problem. We have also attached herewith the link to the spreadsheets with the original and renormalized scores. Stay tuned for further updates.

The original scores can be found in this link:
https://docs.google.com/s...

The correctly renormalized scores can be found in this link:
https://docs.google.com/s...

short_message: In what can be termed as a historic event for alumni-generated funding of IITs, Shion Deysarkar, CEO of Datafiniti and son of US-based entrepreneurs and
message:
In what can be termed as a historic event for alumni-generated funding of IITs, Shion Deysarkar, CEO of Datafiniti and son of US-based entrepreneurs and IIT Kharagpur’s alumni Dr. Asoke Deysarkar and Dr. Ruma Acharya Deysarkar, has donated a whopping sum of 2 crores to his parents’ alma mater in what is a first of its kind instance.

A MoU has been signed regarding the funds and it will be utilized towards setting up three Chair Professorships in the domains of Geology & Geophysics, Chemical Engineering and Chemistry/Mining Engineering at IIT KGP’s Asoke Deysarkar and Ruma Acharya Centre of Excellence in Petroleum Engineering.

Shion Deysarkar, who is American by birth and upbringing and a data scientist from Carnegie Mellon University, says that this is an opportunity for him to help his parents continue their work at IIT-KGP and also finds it as an interesting way to merge Indian and American academic cultures to create mutual beneficiaries.

The director Prof. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti and the recently appointed Dean of Alumni affairs Prof. Subrata Chattopadhyay warmly welcomed this move and reckoned that this amount would not only be of great importance for IIT Kharagpur to maintain its legacy in several initiatives but also prove to be an ice-breaker for Alumni progeny to associate themselves with the culture of contributing to the IIT ecosystem.

Source: https://economictimes.ind...

short_message: Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This
message:
Our fellow KGPians have now and again made the country proud with their innovative ideas being showcased at the best of the platforms in the world. This time, it’s the Team Infinity from IIT Kharagpur which bagged the third prize in the Innovation Summit Bold Ideas Competition at Paris organized by Schneider Electric, one of the biggest players in the field of renewable energy. The team consisting of Nawazish Parwez, Nihal Gupta, Soumya Dubey, Akash Kumar and Gaurav Kumar (right to left in photograph) performed exceptionally well in the first round of the competition that saw a participation of more than 240 teams from 40+ countries all around the world to secure a place among the top 10 teams to showcase their talent in the summit to be held in Paris. Their idea was based on the hybrid solar panel which increases the efficiency of the existing conventional system, using the modern principles of Materials and Environmental Engineering. The idea was appreciated by the judging panel consisting of environmentalists and scientists all around the globe.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all of them for bringing laurels to the institute and encourages the student community to participate in such competitions.

short_message: A soon-to-be-published book 'Groundwater of South Asia' edited by an IIT Kharagpur Associate Professor, Prof. Abhijit Mukherjee, suggests setting up of
message:
A soon-to-be-published book 'Groundwater of South Asia' edited by an IIT Kharagpur Associate Professor, Prof. Abhijit Mukherjee, suggests setting up of a “Groundwater mission” which would help to tackle the problems associated with hydraulic dissipation in the South-Asian region, mainly comprising arsenic and fluoride pollution and storage anomaly.

Attached to the Department of Geology & Geophysics in the institute's School of Environmental Science and Engineering, Prof. Mukherjee has worked in different parts of South Asia, looking at groundwater issues for almost two decades.

It is noteworthy that despite being the fruit-bearer of three large water systems, almost half the water that enters the South Asian hydrologic system is dissipated by poorly understood and quantified processes. Although there have been several projects to accelerate and improve the drinking water supply in India, such as “Rajeev Gandhi Drinking Water Mission” and “National Rural Drinking Water Programme”, Prof. Mukherjee’s book recommends that there is a dire need of a groundwater mission on similar lines.

Source: http://www.business-stand...

short_message: Around a month ago, most of us witnessed some great effort put in by few halls in the Inter-Hall Gardening competition and the fresh pictures of lovely
message:
Around a month ago, most of us witnessed some great effort put in by few halls in the Inter-Hall Gardening competition and the fresh pictures of lovely gardens were enthusiastically shared. Unfortunately, or rather habitually, the gardens haven’t taken long to topple off the peak. Given that lot of effort by Hall staffs and considerable money (as high as Rs. 50,000) goes into preparation for this competition, we must ponder over the meaningfulness of this competition and alter our approach to the maintenance of Hall gardens.
Find the full report here: https://medium.com/@awaaz...

short_message: West Bengal has always been rich in culture and heritage, also due to the British rule of East India Company establishing its roots in India through Kolkata.
message:
West Bengal has always been rich in culture and heritage, also due to the British rule of East India Company establishing its roots in India through Kolkata. But we have lost our culture, haven’t we? If not fully, then to a great extent.

The Department of Humanities and Social Sciences of IIT Kharagpur is teaming up with the University of Liverpool, UK to aid conservation efforts in the state of West Bengal and help in protecting the cultural heritage of cities and towns along the course of Hooghly river. The places where the project will focus are Bandel, Chinsurah, Chandannagar, Serampore, and Barrackpore which are former trading posts and garrison settlements along the Hooghly. The project is being jointly funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK and the Indian Council for Historical Research.

Source- http://indianexpress.com/...

short_message: #Robotics, Autonomous Vehicles and Deep Learning conference 2018 which is going to be organized during September 10-11, 2018 in Singapore. Our Organization
message:
#Robotics, Autonomous Vehicles and Deep Learning conference 2018 which is going to be organized during September 10-11, 2018 in Singapore. Our Organization is very much delighted to invite you and your Lab or department. Smart Robotic Conference 2018 is offering a wide range of benefits to promote and expose your research and services to the large number of audience and also if you want you can collaborate with us.

As the hardest problems of technology can only be solved by the open collaboration of world-wide scientific community. In order to make conference successful, participation from great organization like yours is very much required and we are expecting a large number of participants from your side for our conference.

For event details please log into: http://robotics.conferenc... /

By collaborating with us you can avail the following benefits:
• Display of logos on all event paraphernalia and areas around the event space as required.
• Access to our attendees & delegates
• Collaborators will get 25% discount on Conference registrations.
• Special Group discount to your members to attend the Smart Robotic Congress 2018
• Opportunity to organize a workshop at any one of our events.
• Registered Organizations logo will be displayed in the respective conference and supporting journal webpage with a statement 'supported by'
• Registered Organization for exhibition can organize a small symposium/exhibit a stall with complimentary registration pass at the event
• You may avail one Free Conference pass for the board of director/ higher management from associated organization.

Events in smart robotics congress 2018:
• Speaker slots for keynote talk and plenary talk for doctorates, professors, post-doctoral fellows and young research forum.
• Workshops/Symposium platform for Doctorates and Professors.
• Exhibitor booths for Robot Industries.
• Poster presentation for students.

Thanks and Regards
Sincerely
Jack kallis
Conference Manager
Smart Robotics Congress 2018
47 Churchfield Road, London, W3 6AY, UK
Toll Free: USA: 1 (800) 216 6499 | UK: 44-800-098-8455 | Tokyo: 81-345780247

If you are unable to attend/if you are not given a chance to pose your questions in the session, you may kindly fill this form immediately even during the evening, there is a panel of unbiased moderators who would pick relevant questions and ask the candidates in public.

short_message: Voting for the election of the next set of office bearers is underway at the Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. Students are pouring in large
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 9 new photos — with Anant Yadav and Anubhav Raj.
message:
Voting for the election of the next set of office bearers is underway at the Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur. Students are pouring in large numbers. There are two voting booths, one in the Assembly Hall (on the right, near Squash Court) and another in the Old Badminton Court (on the left, near president's and sports officer's office). However, there is scorching sun out there but that doesn't seem to deter the spirits of voters. Apart from the lunch break from 1 to 2 PM, the voting will go on from 2PM to 6PM.
What are you waiting for? Go and cast your vote!
#Your_Choice_Your_Vote_Your_Voice
#Aapka_Vote_Aapki_Awaaz

short_message: Technology is in the name and a very essential part of our lives as KGPians and for this reason along with a multitude of others, the post of General Secretary
message:
Technology is in the name and a very essential part of our lives as KGPians and for this reason along with a multitude of others, the post of General Secretary Technology is very important for charting out a direction of where our public interests in this field are taking us.

This year, we have two candidates for the post who are running unopposed but we still consider the proposals of a candidate important and hence provide our views on what we think of each and every single proposal and the background work done for it.

Stay Tuned and Happy Voting!
https://web.scholarsavenu...

short_message: Sports has always been a very crucial part of the KGP culture. With an ever-increasing sporting community and a similar trend being followed by the competition
message:
Sports has always been a very crucial part of the KGP culture. With an ever-increasing sporting community and a similar trend being followed by the competition in the Inter-IIT Meets, new and fresh perspectives to improve the sporting culture in the campus are required which, not necessarily, must be built on the foundations laid by the previous incumbents.

This election season has 4 competitors fighting it out for the post of General Secretary Sports and Games. Each one of them has come up with ideas on how they think they can improve the standard and quality of the KGP sporting culture and has laid down proposals along the same lines. We have done our part in breaking down their proposals into usable bits which collectively can put the voter in a better position to understand them and make the right choice in today's elections.

Presenting to you our critique of the G.Sec- Sports and Games 2018-19.

Stay tuned for more and Happy voting!

https://web.scholarsavenue.org/critique-general-secretary-sports-2018-19-38b4387dd321

short_message: World Health Day is celebrated on 7th April every year in a hope to raise awareness among people about the importance of health and well-being in our lives
message:
World Health Day is celebrated on 7th April every year in a hope to raise awareness among people about the importance of health and well-being in our lives and how our own habits affect our mental as well as physical health. The theme for World Health Day 2018 is “Universal Health Coverage: Health for all”. On the occasion of World Health Day, let us pray for everyone’s well-being, improve our lifestyles and take one step ahead towards a healthy life.

Also, let us come up and vote to choose the right candidates in TSG Elections 2018. We control our own destiny to a large extent. Let us break the system of our vote getting influenced by others. Voice your own opinion.
#YourChoice_YourVote_YourVoice
#HealthForAll

short_message: It's just a few minutes away from D-Day, the day when the student community of KGP gets to exercise its democratic power and instate new leaders in positions
message:
It's just a few minutes away from D-Day, the day when the student community of KGP gets to exercise its democratic power and instate new leaders in positions of responsibilities meant to push forward agendas and proposals directed towards a better KGP. The SOP's have concluded, as always with enough entertainment to last for more than just a heartbeat, but on a serious note, the SOP's have provided every candidate with a platform to outline their proposals for improving some aspect of the campus and defending them to their fiercest extent, in front of the entire KGP community.

As always, it isn't easy to gauge the proposals put forward by the candidates at first glance and given that the proposals should be undoubtedly taken into account for influencing a voter's mind, we at The Scholars' Avenue have done some of the work of simplifying the proposals and breaking it down into chunks easy enough for everyone to understand.

We present to you the first of our critique series for this election season - General Secretary Social and Cultural 2018-19. We will come out with the others soon enough. Stay tuned and Happy voting!

https://web.scholarsavenu...

short_message: Have you ever thought what happens, after the candidates are elected, to those proposals? Should the VP and other elected TSG representatives be asked
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message:
Have you ever thought what happens, after the candidates are elected, to those proposals? Should the VP and other elected TSG representatives be asked to give a public review of their proposals?
A question that has time and again surfaced and the opinion of the student community has always been positive about it with 95.63% of poll respondents accenting in a poll carried out by Awaaz last year.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents a summary of the proposal updates of the General Secretaries, Sports and Games, Harsh Saraf and Manish Datta. However, their counterparts for Technology (Anmol Shakya and Anusha Sharan) and Social and Cultural (Vaibhav Dusad and Aman Choudhary) didn't give the Proposal Updates to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur.

The video for the interview can be found here: http://bit.ly/GSecSports

The elections in KGP have always been amongst the high octane affairs and the proposals made by the candidates may well be driven by the energy and powerful ambitions rather than the proper feasibility study. Most of the times, one year may be a time duration too small for carrying out the tasks according to the proposals. We also consider that the representatives have so many other issues to deal with. We believe that the students must get to know what happened in a particular representative's tenure so that everyone has a record that can help the subsequent representatives in taking further decisions.

short_message:
IIT-KGP’s path-breaking project of the bio-electric toilet has won the Prime Minister’s Swachha Bharat Award!

The civil engineering department
message:
IIT-KGP’s path-breaking project of the bio-electric toilet has won the Prime Minister’s Swachha Bharat Award!

The civil engineering department of IIT-KGP, with the assistance of School of Environmental Science & Engg. and P K Sinha Centre for Bioenergy has made a bio-toilet, whose giant flush needs to be filled with 500 litres of water, which then recycles itself for a lifetime of use, which can stretch up to 15 years. Moreover, the waste can also be used to generate electricity!
Prof. Makarand Ghangrekar of the civil engineering department, who is the project leader, believes that the toilet would solve the problems of water crisis associated and meet the needs of rural sanitation.
Follow the link below for the complete news report
https://timesofindia.indi...

short_message: The Ministry of Human Resource Development released the annual rankings of colleges under the National Institutional Ranking Framework, which ranks the
message:
The Ministry of Human Resource Development released the annual rankings of colleges under the National Institutional Ranking Framework, which ranks the best colleges and universities in India. IIT Kharagpur has slipped one place in the overall rankings, dropping from 4th to 5th position despite an increase in the overall score from 68.43 to 71.39 (out of 100). IISc Bengaluru continues to be on the top of the overall rankings.

IIT Kharagpur's score under 'Outreach and Inclusivity' (OI) parameter has seen a significant decrease from a total of 72.85 to 56.16. There is also a drop from 64.72 to 62.1 in the score of 'Perception' which involves the perception of students, employers, investors, and public.

However, in a remarkable feat, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the first rank in Architecture rankings with a total score of 78.41.
Also, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, IIT Kharagpur (RGSOIPL) and Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur (VGSoM) have bagged fourth and seventh position respectively in Law and Management categories which stands testimony to KGP's excellence in the respective fields despite the presence of top-class NLUs, IIMs and other premier universities.

Picture Courtesy: Partha P Chakrabarti, Director IIT Kharagpur.
For more details, please visit https://www.nirfindia.org...

short_message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur invites applications for the Gymkhana Awards in Technology, 2017-18 for the following awards:

1.
message:
Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur invites applications for the Gymkhana Awards in Technology, 2017-18 for the following awards:

1. G.S. Sanyal Cup
2. Institute Order of Merit
3. Honourable Mention
4. Ankik Dhar Trophy (Outgoing All rounder with involvement in all three events Sports and Games, Social and Cultural and Technology and exceptional performance in at least one of them)
5. Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)

In the resumes following information can be included:

1. Inter IIT Participation, and achievement if any
2. Intra and Inter College/University Participation in competitions, and achievement if any
3. Participation in various national and international conferences as a student of IIT Kharagpur, and achievement if any
4. Meaningful projects and technical paper publications
5. Positions of Responsibility held at the Gymkhana or any other organisation in the institute
6. Any other contribution to IIT Kharagpur at the Institute level

Any student awarded punishment by the Standing Disciplinary Committee of the Institute/Examination Malpractice Prevention Committee of the Institute shall not be eligible for Gymkhana awards.

Mail your resumes and relevant documents (for the verification of credentials) to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com at the earliest.

Application Deadline - 6th April 2018, 11.59 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be entertained.

6. Alumni Cup (Best Sportsmen in the current year) - only non-graduating students are eligible to apply.
7. Ankik Dhar Trophy (Graduating all-rounder with involvement in all three events Sports and Games, Social and Cultural and Technology and exceptional performance in at least one of them)

In the resumes following information can be included:
1.Inter IIT Participation and achievement if any.
2.Inter College/University Participation and achievement if any
3.Participation in various standard tournaments as a student of IIT Kharagpur and achievement if any.
4.Positions of responsibility held in the Gymkhana.
5.Any other contribution to IIT Kharagpur (Institute level).

Any student awarded punishment by the Standing Disciplinary Committee of the Institute / Examination Malpractice Prevention Committee of the institute shall not be eligible for Gymkhana awards.

Mail your Sports resumes and relevant documents to gsecsportsiitkgp@gmail.com at the earliest.

Application Deadline - 8th April 2018 by 11 PM.

No applications beyond the deadline will be entertained.

short_message: In a further development in the recent case of candidature form being torn, we were today approached by the concerned stakeholder who had claimed that
message:
In a further development in the recent case of candidature form being torn, we were today approached by the concerned stakeholder who had claimed that his form was torn, to get his public apology issued through our page. Here it goes:
'Dear KGP Junta,
This message is regarding the complaint I have filed with the administration about the misconduct in the election process by two undergraduate students of a certain Hall of Residence.
The Dean (UG), Election Officer and other Professors present in the meeting brought to my notice that my act of letting KGP populace know about the said incident and the contents of the e-mail conversation in which I was a party too, through campus media bodies without proper consent of the authorities was a mistake. I sincerely apologize to all the KGP students and the professors involved in for the way I handled this matter.
Regards
Application No. ** '

short_message: IIT Kharagpur, a few months ago, observed growing discontent against the facilities and functioning of B C Roy Technology Hospital among its students.
message:
IIT Kharagpur, a few months ago, observed growing discontent against the facilities and functioning of B C Roy Technology Hospital among its students. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur requested the students to respond to a google form where they could let us know about the problems the student community is facing in view of an allegedly incompetent hospital that is meant to serve a population of around 20,000 people. The form was received by the KGP community with utmost sincerity and close to 900 responses were recorded of which some contained valuable suggestions too. This report is a compilation of the problems that the hospital is facing and possible solutions considering the practical situation of the institute.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/bc...

short_message: Academic passion and hard work when coupled lead to astonishing results. Who better to personify these words than Dr. Sanghamitra Bandyopadhyay, an internationally
message:
Academic passion and hard work when coupled lead to astonishing results. Who better to personify these words than Dr. Sanghamitra Bandyopadhyay, an internationally recognized researcher in Computer science, specializing in computational biology and currently the director of the Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata. She completed her M. Tech in Computer science from IIT Kharagpur in 1993 with Dr. Shankar Dayal Sharma Gold medal and Institute Silver medal.

Dr. Sanghamitra has worked in various Universities and Institutes worldwide including USA, Australia, Germany, China. She has authored/co-authored more than 300 research articles in international journals, conferences, and book chapters, and published six authored and edited books. She was awarded the prestigious Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prize in Engineering Science in 2010, Infosys Prize 2017 and Third World Academy of Science Prize, 2018.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur got a lucky chance as she took out time from her incredibly hectic schedule to interact with us. In this edition of our series 'JEWELS OF KGP', we present to you a tale of extreme dedication through an insight into the life of this widely respected researcher and administrator.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/sa...

short_message:
General Championship Summary

General Championship Sports and Games 2017-2018

Azad sealed this year’s General Championship Sports
message:
General Championship Summary

General Championship Sports and Games 2017-2018

Azad sealed this year’s General Championship Sports and Games converting last year’s silver to gold this year. Apart from lawn tennis, the finals for all the other sports and games have been concluded. Currently, MMM stands at the second position. If MS manages to win GC Lawn tennis then it would be the bearer of the second position provided MMM is not able to win third place play-off for lawn tennis.

The current standings are:
1. Azad (61 points)
2. MMM (38 points)
3. Nehru (33 points)

General Championship Technology 2017-2018

Continuing its legacy, Azad continues to be at the first position currently. Two events are yet to be conducted, namely OpenSoft and Hardware Modelling. The results of Maths Olympiad are yet to be declared whereas there is an ambiguity in the results of ChemQuest which would soon be resolved in the coming sub-committee meeting.

The current standings without considering the current result of ChemQuest are:
1. Azad (265 points)
2. RP (225 points)
3. LBS (175 points)

General Championship Social and Cultural 2017-2018

Out of 22 events, 7 events are yet to be conducted. RK manages to hold the first position leading Patel by 70 points. There is a massive difference between the first position and the third position of over 200 points.

The current standings are:
1. RK (525 points)
2. Patel (455 points)
3. Azad (315 points)

For further details, check
http://awaaziitkgp.org/GC...

short_message: Gymkhana Elections are less than a week away and the KGP community is keeping social media abuzz with related content. The voters and their mindset play
message:
Gymkhana Elections are less than a week away and the KGP community is keeping social media abuzz with related content. The voters and their mindset play a major role in shaping up of the future of the institute, and the right mindset will be achieved if and only if everybody has the basic knowledge of the issues pertaining to the campus and the electoral process.

Common people don't get to share their viewpoints with the authority on those issues and this survey aims to reduce the gap and let the voices be heard. The survey form constitutes of two parts, one about the electoral process, and another about the issues ranging from mess and placements to hospital and counseling centre. Your problems can only be solved if you state them. So, give a minute or two to fill this form out, state your queries and suggestions and give yourself an opportunity to be a prominent part of the institute.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appeals to the student community to fill up the form before Tuesday [03/04/2018] midnight so that the survey report may be published early enough.
https://docs.google.com/f...

story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
“Bring a life back to power. Make blood donation your responsibility”, with similar message Blood donation camp was organized by Kharagpur Voluntary Blood Donors Forum and NSS, IIT Kharagpur on 31 st March 2018 from 10 am to 2 pm in Old Badminton Court, Technology Students' Gymkhana under the guidance of Prof. Arghya Deb with around 84 enthusiastic volunteers turning up for the camp. Volunteers were also awarded certificates for this noble work for giving someone a new life as one can't do much about the length of his own life, but by donating blood one surely can do something with its' width and depth.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur expresses its' gratitude for all those who donated blood and appeals the student community to increase their involvement in these kinds of activities.

short_message: In the recent case of a student being intimidated and his form getting torn, Awaaz got to know another side of the story. Here's the other side of the
message:
In the recent case of a student being intimidated and his form getting torn, Awaaz got to know another side of the story. Here's the other side of the issue as expressed by concerned stakeholders. This is what they have to say (this is strictly their side of the story and not Awaaz's):
'This recent issue has already gained a lot of momentum, though in a bad way, however, we would like to make a few things clear. The student, who claimed to have been mishandled on our part, left out a great deal of information regarding the whole incident.
First of all, we encourage any student who wants to contest for elections to come forward through proper channels, or at least contest with the right intentions.
Entrusted with the job role of working for the hall members and the betterment of college, it is our responsibility and duty to encourage students to contest for the posts. We approached the student to understand his level of clarity regarding the post he was applying for and his intentions. On understanding that the whole affair was because of a bet between the said student and his friend from another hall of residence, we found out that they were playing around with the election process, simply competing among themselves just to see who gets more votes. This is the kind of behaviour that shames the student community and gives KGP elections a bad name.
Hence, we advised the student against filing a nomination as this degrades the seriousness and undermines the respect this post commands. After this, we again approached the student and encouraged the student to formally contest, with our support, provided his intentions were clear and just. However, the student backed out and said the whole affair was just a joke, or a prank, on his part and he never had any serious intentions of contesting.
If the student has any proof of any of what he claims to have happened, we encourage him to come forward and present it to the student community.
It was an immature act of fiddling up with the elections and we highly condemn this kind of act which disrespects the posts of VP, TSG.'

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur contacted the other concerned stakeholder who affirmed that another student who had also taken candidature form, accepted the fact that they both were doing it just for fun and they were not serious about it at all.

We, at Awaaz, have just tried to present the viewpoints of both the sides and do not claim any particular viewpoint of these two to be true. We do not intend to shove any particular viewpoint as absolute truth down the throats of students community.

short_message: Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Associate Professor, Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering has been awarded Abdul Kalam Technology
message:
Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Associate Professor, Department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering has been awarded Abdul Kalam Technology Innovation National Fellowship by the Indian National Academy of Engineering. He joined the institute in 2005. His research areas include Medical Image and Signal Processing, Content-based Medical Image Retrieval, Continuous Authentication, Video Processing.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes our professor all the best in his future endeavours!

short_message: Our Alumni keep showering their love time to time for their alma mater. This time it is the IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) in the United States who
message:
Our Alumni keep showering their love time to time for their alma mater. This time it is the IIT Kharagpur Foundation (IITKGPF) in the United States who has offered to fund the foreign internships of students who wish to pursue high-quality research and professional internships at reputed global universities such as the University of Cambridge, University of Columbia, MIT and University of Chicago among others. The IITKGPF is a not for profit organization headquartered in Nebraska. 14 students from various disciplines have been selected as part of the IITKGPF's 'Award Program for International Internships' which was launched in March. The reputation of the host institution, the quality of proposed research and the academic standing of the student are taken into account before giving the final awards. The students will receive monetary grants upto USD 3000 through direct payments for eligible expenses like airfare, stay and so on. The move will encourage the students who miss out on the opportunities due to huge travel expenses and cost of living.

Source- http://www.business-stand...

short_message: The first phase Pre-Conclave of the 2nd Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) Youth Conclave was hosted by IIT Kharagpur from 23rd March to 25th
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 18 new photos — with Divyam Jain.
message:
The first phase Pre-Conclave of the 2nd Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) Youth Conclave was hosted by IIT Kharagpur from 23rd March to 25th March 2018. The Opening Ceremony was inaugurated by Prof. Partha Pratim Chakrabarti (Director), Prof. Sriman Kumar Bhattacharyya (Deputy Director), Prof. Manoj Kumar Tiwari (Dean of Planning and Coordination) and Prof. Jayanta Mukhopadhyay. INAE Youth Conclave aims at facilitating the engagement of Indian youth in engineering activities at national level.

This time competition was divided into three categories and then further subdivided into a total of six events as follow:
(1) Academic Planning
(2) Product Design and Development
(i) Town Planning
(ii) Optimising Food Chain Aspects
(iii) Swach Bharath Abhiyan
(3) Mobile Application Development
(i) Health Care App Development
(ii) Digitalisation in Agriculture

The results of the Pre-Conclave are as follow:
(1) Academic Planning
1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 166)
2nd Prize: MMM Engineering College, Gorakhpur (Team 244)
3rd Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 252)

(2) Town Planning
1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 129)
2nd Prize: PSG Institue of Technology and Applied Research (Team 75)
3rd Prize: Techno India, Salt Lake (Team 25)

(3) Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
1st Prize: Raj Kumar Goel Institute of Technology & Management (Team 81)
2nd Prize: IES IPS Academy, Indore, M.P. (Team 82)
3rd Prize: VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology, Hyderabad (Team 56)

(4) Optimizing food chain aspects
1st Prize: School of Aeronautics, Neemrana (Team 97)
2nd Prize: Ambedkar Institute Of Technology For Handicapped, Kanpur (Team 136)
3rd Prize: Chandigarh University, Gharuan, Mohal (Team 140)

(5) Healthcare app Development
1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 139)
2nd Prize: Chettinad College of Engineering & Technology (Team 100)
3rd Prize: Chandigarh University (Team 165)

(6) Digitalization of Agriculture
1st Prize: IIT Kharagpur (Team 123)
2nd Prize: Bhagalpur College of Engineering, Bhagalpur (Team 201)
3rd Prize: Chandigarh University (Team 155)

In the second phase of INAE Youth Conclave, the shortlisted teams will be developing the existing solutions and solving new problems related to their problem statement. The final presentation will be on 10-12 August 2018. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the shortlisted teams and wishes all the best for the final conclave.

short_message: A condolence meeting will be organized at 6 pm on 31st March in the common room of Nehru Hall of Residence due to the sad demise of Nanda Kishore. He was
message:
A condolence meeting will be organized at 6 pm on 31st March in the common room of Nehru Hall of Residence due to the sad demise of Nanda Kishore. He was a fifth-year undergraduate student in the department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering. He was suffering from Intestinal tuberculosis which was detected very late. Though the surgery was successful, he had multiple organ failures and passed away on the night of 28th March. Dean SA and Dean UG are expected to be present for the same.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the student community to attend the condolence meet and pray for the peace of his soul.

short_message:
Results of Freshers Selections

For the past couple of weeks, we were in the process of recruiting people who will take Kharagpur Open Source
message:
Results of Freshers Selections

For the past couple of weeks, we were in the process of recruiting people who will take Kharagpur Open Source Society forward in the upcoming academic session. Buoyed by the participation of current 1st-year students, we have rigorously vetted and discussed each person who interviewed with us. Having said this, we believe that any selection process(including our’s) should not be considered as the sole criteria to judge one’s own self-worth as a programmer. Each one of us is a diamond underneath the surface. Thus, we would like to congratulate everyone who worked on their tasks after interviews and presented it to us.

We welcome the following individuals to the KOSS team:

Aaryan Bhagat

short_message: Mahadevi Varma, widely regarded as the ‘Modern Meera’, was a Hindi poet, freedom fighter, woman's rights activist and educationist. Considered to be one
message:
Mahadevi Varma, widely regarded as the ‘Modern Meera’, was a Hindi poet, freedom fighter, woman's rights activist and educationist. Considered to be one of the four pillars of ‘Chhayavaad, which was a literary movement of romanticism in modern Hindi poetry, she has been awarded various honours including Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan, Sahitya Akademi Fellowship and Jnanpith Award. Her works reside in the hearts of thousands of lovers of Hindi literature. Many of us must be remembering ‘Gillu’, ‘Neelkanth’ and ‘Mere Bachpan Ke Din’, some of her great works included in textbooks.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur remembers Mahadevi Varma on her 111th birth anniversary and salutes her contribution to Hindi Literature.

short_message: Technology Intervention in Indian Agriculture can make a BIG difference in lives of millions of people. AgNEXT is an initiative of the Prof. Mrigank Sharad,
message:
Technology Intervention in Indian Agriculture can make a BIG difference in lives of millions of people. AgNEXT is an initiative of the Prof. Mrigank Sharad, an assistant professor at the department of Electronics and Electrical Communication Engineering, IIT Kharagpur. It offers a platform to ideate, innovate, prototype and commercialize impactful technology solutions and services. AgNEXT is working on several different verticals that are coordinated by dedicated experts. It has a team of senior KGP students leading different target products and currently it is looking forward to inviting new enthusiasts. With AgNEXT you get to participate and lead development of products and solutions that are based on real needs of Indian agriculture and can have significant impact on the rural economy. It is looking forward to a long term association with KGPians who are passionate about using their talents and skills for socially relevant and impactful technology solutions for rural India! Rewards, fellowships and recognition will follow passionate effort and coordinated outcomes!

Please fill out the following form if you are interested:

https://goo.gl/forms/4aLx...

short_message: The Leadership Summit 2018 organised by the Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur  saw four of IIT Kgp's Alumni coming on stage to tell the students about their experiences
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 7 new photos.
message: The Leadership Summit 2018 organised by the Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur  saw four of IIT Kgp's Alumni coming on stage to tell the students about their experiences of leading teams in various spheres whether it is being the CEO of a big multi-national company, an administrative lead post in the government or leading a successful startup team. The meet featured Mr. Modan Saha who is the CEO of Tata Strategic Management Group, Mr. Sandipan Deb who is Editor-Director at Swarajya, Mr. Sachchidanand Rai, the Chairman of Eden Realty Group and Mr. Shrey Goyal, the founder of Sustainable Growth Initiative. They laid down the importance of benevolence and honesty while simultaneously being sharp and smart in your approach to climb the steps in the corporate world. Citing their experiences, they told how you have to respect and admire your teammates in order to gain back their respect for you as a leader. Each of us can become a leader if we believe in ourselves and make full use of the opportunities coming our way. They also emphasised the fact that how IITians have been serving for the betterment of humanity and how they have made a special place for themselves in the world. It was inspiring to hear from them what it means to be a true leader.

short_message: Celebrates the spirit of student innovation in all the fields of engineering, science, technology, and design through extremely affordable/frugal solution,
message:
Celebrates the spirit of student innovation in all the fields of engineering, science, technology, and design through extremely affordable/frugal solution, Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards were given to those who had the courage to push the technological edge. Dealing with numerous aspects like communities at grassroots, co-creation with grassroots innovators, manufacturable technologies for saving or generating energy, sanitation, water purification, saving material consumption, biotechnology and medical devices, diagnostics, assistive devices for physically challenged, and all others areas of social and industrial applications, overall 23 awards were given to students of various Indian institutes. Bikash Ranjan Tiwari and Md. Tabish Noori from IIT Kgp while working under the guidance of Prof. Makarand Madhao Ghangrekar received this award
Award summary is as follows :
• IIT Madras – 3
• IIT Bombay - 3
• IIT Delhi - 3
• IIT Kharagpur - 2
• IIT Hyderabad - 2
• Institute of Chemical Technology Mumbai-2
• IIT Kanpur - 1
• IIT Roorkee - 1
• IISC Bangalore - 1
• IIT Guwahati -1
• Tezpur University, Assam -1
• National Dairy Research Institute, Bangalore -1
• Dr D.Y. Patil Vidyapeeth Pune - 1
• Don Bosco High School Assam - 1


For further information one can follow the given link :
http://gyti.techpedia.in/...

short_message: Founded by Deepak Malhotra and Rajan Bajaj, SlicePay is a digital payment platform which was founded with a mission to simplify payments for the young.
message:
Founded by Deepak Malhotra and Rajan Bajaj, SlicePay is a digital payment platform which was founded with a mission to simplify payments for the young. Rajan Bajaj is an IIT Kharagpur alumni who graduated from the institute in 2014 with a degree in Civil Engineering. Rajan Bajaj, Co-Founder and CEO of SlicePay says, “Students’ spending power has significantly increased over the last few years as Indian parents now spend more on education, leading to a strong need for a frictionless lending solution for millennials”. We got an opportunity to interact with him.

http://awaaziitkgp.org/ky...

short_message:
'है नमन उनको कि जो यशकाय को अमरत्व देकर,
इस जगत के शौर्य की जीवित कहानी हो गये हैं |
है नमन उनको कि जिनके सामने बौना हिमालय,
जो धरा पर
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 14 new photos — with Venkappayya Desai and 3 others.
message:
'है नमन उनको कि जो यशकाय को अमरत्व देकर,
इस जगत के शौर्य की जीवित कहानी हो गये हैं |
है नमन उनको कि जिनके सामने बौना हिमालय,
जो धरा पर गिर पड़े पर आसमानी हो गये हैं |'

Yesterday, on the account of Shaheedi Diwas, a rally was organized by Samvaad in association with Technology Students' Gymkhana, followed by a Kavi Sammelan by Technology literary Society. The rally, which started at Gymkhana and concluded at the Nehru Museum, was full of enthusiastic sloganeers who enchanted patriotic slogans like 'Vande Mataram', 'Bharat Mata ki Jai'. At Nehru Museum, proceedings started with the National Song, followed by words of Bhagat Singh which reads as, ' They may kill me, but they cannot kill my ideas. They can crush my body, but they will not be able to crush my spirit '. Further, the anchor narrated the history of Hijli detention camp and two freedom fighters who were hanged there (Hijli detention camp)- Santosh Kumar Mitra and Tarkeshwar Sengupta. Thereafter, the president of the event, Prof Virendra Kumar Tewari (Agriculture & Food Engineering Department) spoke about the comparison between the mentality of those youth freedom fighters with nowadays youth about freedom. Then he welcomed Chief Guest of the event, Commander Veerendra Kumar Jaitely, an IIT Kgp alumnus.

Commander Jaitely saluted the brave freedom fighters and then told about one shaheed of IIT Kharagpur, V.K.Jain (INS Khukri) from Electronics Department, 1966 Batch. He gave an idea about the fight for freedom and inspired us to fight for our country for taking it to the top. Thereafter, Kavi Sammelan began which witnessed many extremely talented students recite their verse. The event concluded with the National Anthem.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur encourages student community to conduct more such events and actively participate in it!

In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs.
message:
In an attempt to build indigenous technologies for commercial usage our institute is working on developing an ecosystem of budding technical entrepreneurs. One such project on Rain and Fog removal from Video Sequences has been taken up by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay and his team. Patents have been filed in US, Europe and South Korea. Basic application has been shown to work and is being approached by the world top leaders in Defence and Transportation. To scale up the work and improve the commercial viability of the product interns are being hired to work in the following related fields. Interested and enthusiastic students are invited to fill in the google form below. They will be invited to the recruitment drive soon.

https://goo.gl/forms/Dn5i...

Interns required in the following domains : Product Development, Android Programming, CUDA C, Image Processing, Machine Learning

Eligibility : Anyone interested is invited
Time Period : Summers 2018 and beyond
Stipend : Will be provided on the basis of alloted work

For any queries you can contact Professor Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, Department of E&ECE, IIT Kharagpur.

story: Team KART-Formula SAE team of IIT-Kharagpur shared Team XLR8's post.
message:
Team KART-Formula SAE team of IIT-Kharagpur shared Team XLR8's post.

Knock Knock! The red letter day of automobile enthusiasts of Kolkata and Jadavpur University is coming closer. So get ready to experience the bang presented by us with the collaboration with Team Kart. We are overwhelmed with the presence of our honourable chief Chief Guest Mr. Prasanth Tharani.
In case you have missed to register still do it as soon as possible as the event is incomplete without your presence.
Link of Registration: given in the comment section
Please follow the schedule of the event given below for your convenience

[**All participants will receive certificates.
**Technical presentations and software training will be imparted by Team KART technical team heads.
**Prashanth Tharani, a well-known professional touring car racer is the Chief Guest.]

So 23 hours more to wait and then see you guys over there on time :D

Registration link: https://docs.google.com/f...

short_message:
We are glad to announce that Mr. Prashanth Tharani will be gracing our workshop with his presence.
Winner of Polo R Cup race in China, 2016, this
message:
We are glad to announce that Mr. Prashanth Tharani will be gracing our workshop with his presence.
Winner of Polo R Cup race in China, 2016, this man needs no introduction. Mr. Tharani has also competed for Zest Race Car Engineering, and drove Seat Eurocup car for them in the Creventic Endurance races in Barcelona and Czech Republic in 2016.

If you still haven't registered for the workshop, make sure you do now ! Don't miss the chance. Register yourself at : -
https://tinyurl.com/TeamK...

Make sure to witness the racing prowess of this driver as he talks about his experience and his current automotive indulgences, in the Workshop on Automotive Engineering, on Friday the 23rd.

#jadavpur
#teamkart
#xlr8
#sae
#formulastudent
#workshop

short_message: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. Let us enjoy every second of our existence and help others enjoy in whatsoever way
message:
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. Let us enjoy every second of our existence and help others enjoy in whatsoever way we can because a smile doesn't cost us, but it means the world to many.

The International Day of Happiness is celebrated every year on 20th March to recognise the importance of happiness, well-being and kindness in our lives. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a fruitful day of happiness.

short_message:
We come across a lot of problems, get stuck in some complicated chains and have a lot of queries every single day!
Whom should we turn to?
The
message:
We come across a lot of problems, get stuck in some complicated chains and have a lot of queries every single day!
Whom should we turn to?
The answer is here! Institute Wellness Group, IIT Kharagpur has launched the Support Cell, an initiative of the current Vice-President, Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur, Mr.Mayank Srivastava. The cell would serve as the first node of information for any doubts relating to various important domains of student life ranging from mess and maintenance to mental health!
Upon approaching, this team of individuals will enlighten you regarding procedures in the respective domains and respective person(s) in-charge. The current team lead by Krushi Bandi and Yashasvi Kanchaguntla will serve its term until August, 2018.
Hope you all use the service of the team to the best!

short_message:
Quarterfinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Quarterfinal 1: MMM vs HJB (2-0)
1.In singles, Suramya Pandey
message:
Quarterfinals || Lawn Tennis || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports & Games

Quarterfinal 1: MMM vs HJB (2-0)
1.In singles, Suramya Pandey (MMM) beat Akhil Andasu (HJB) by 7-5, 3-6, 6-3 in a hard-fought contest.
2. Suramya Pandey and Anshuman Kumar (MMM) defeated Sanket Mondal and Manish Dutta (HJB) by 6-2, 6-3 in doubles encounter.

Quarterfinal 2: Azad vs RP (2-1)
1. Kunaal Punj(Azad) handed an easy defeat to Rajat Gupta (RP) by 6-3, 6-0 in the first singles match.
2. The duo of Kunaal Punj and Nishant Kumar (Azad) lost to Mihir Kirloskar and Rajat Gupta of RP in doubles encounter by 5-7, 4-6 in a close contest, thus leading to a decider singles match.
3. In the last match, Nishant Kumar from Azad defeated Mihir Kirloskar from RP by 6-4, 6-3 helping Azad qualify for the semifinals.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winning teams and wishes them all the best for semifinals.

short_message: What after graduation? It’s quite confusing for any student with numerous possibilities in corporate jobs and higher education. Provided both of them possess
message: What after graduation? It’s quite confusing for any student with numerous possibilities in corporate jobs and higher education. Provided both of them possess opportunities of their own kind with them, it’s immensely helpful to start thinking at an early stage. International Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organising a Panel Discussion with the graduating students who have secured MS/PhD offers from various renowned foreign universities. Besides, the panel will be guiding the students through the application procedures for MS/PhD in various universities. Be there to get your doubts cleared regarding higher education!

short_message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely
message:
“ The value of higher education is the not learning of many facts but training of mind to think.”
-Albert Einstein

The world is definitely a humongous stage and all humans are merely players, where the ultimate fight is for power acquisition. Everybody wants to acquire fame and engraved his / her name in the golden books of history.If statistics is taken into picture be it Mrs.Indra Nooyi, Dr. Sashi Tharoor or Dr. Manmohan Singh each of the successful Indians has one thing in common: they all are highly educated. In such times, it becomes essential for students to decide whether to pursue higher education or go for corporate jobs. International relations cell, therefore, presents the MS/ Ph.D. panel discussion to help students clear all their doubts regarding MS/ Ph.D. application procedure. Hope to see you see there!

short_message:
“If there’s something you want to build, but the tech isn’t there yet, just find the closest possible way to make it happen.”

To apply for
message:
“If there’s something you want to build, but the tech isn’t there yet, just find the closest possible way to make it happen.”

To apply for this internship- http://bit.ly/MARKETINGKG...

Global Entrepreneur is a purely technical internship program that provides the students an opportunity of enhancing their skills in fields of their interests by working in a startup in a foreign country for 6-8 weeks.

Some of the categories provided are:

Data Analytics
Web Development
Programming
Engineering (specific to mechanical, civil, electrical)
Architecture
Finance
Marketing
Business development
Game development

Process :
Go through the regularly updated sheet of projects available ( http://bit.ly/GEIITKgp )

Meet an AIESECer in IIT KGP.

Create an account on opportunities portal of AIESEC ( www.aiesec.org )
Apply for projects
Skype interview with a startup of your liking
Pay administration fee = Rs.18,000 on approval
Book your flight tickets, apply for visa, get your travel insurance and ISIC
Attend the Outgoing preparation seminar
Have an amazing internship!

To know more about technical internships, register here:
http://www.aiesec.in/glob...

short_message:
Summer internship @ India's fastest growing FinTech Startup
FinBox is a digital lending software company founded by KGP alumni looking for interns
message:
Summer internship @ India's fastest growing FinTech Startup
FinBox is a digital lending software company founded by KGP alumni looking for interns interested in Backend/ Frontend Web development and design

What does FinBox do?

FinBox enables lenders - Banks & NBFCs digitise their user journey and process applications online. We have a wide range of products such as:

Web & mobile frontend
Android SDK for capturing phone data for underwriting
Deep learning API suite for
OCR
Identity Recognition
Text parsing from unstructured data sources like SMS & Email
Big Data Products
Geospatial Data analysis
Fraud detection suite
ML based loan underwriting suite

Their stack is AWS, Django, PostGres, Tensorflow, ReactJS, Airflow with some micro services in GoLang.

Angel List Profile https://angel.co/finbox-in

Open Positions

Junior Front End Engineer - Experience with ReactJS, HTML, CSS required. Brownie points if you can design well
Junior Back End Engineer - Experience in Python required. Familiarity with any web framework like Django or Flask would be valuable
Junior Android Engineer - Experience in android development required
Junior Data Analyst - Experience in Python required

Location

Bangalore

Contact

Send your resumes/ GitHub profile to
srijan@finbox.in,
nikhil@finbox.in

short_message: 'This magical, marvellous food on our plate, this sustenance we absorb, has a story to tell. It has a journey. It leaves a footprint. It leaves a legacy.
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos.
message:
'This magical, marvellous food on our plate, this sustenance we absorb, has a story to tell. It has a journey. It leaves a footprint. It leaves a legacy. To eat with reckless abandon, without conscience, without knowledge; folks, this ain’t normal.” In series of celebrating the 'Gratitude Month' and to remind the student community to express their gratitude to those crucial people who consistently work to make their stay at Kgp elated and gleeful, another random act of kindness was being displayed by IWG members under which they served food to mess workers along with other students in the LBS hall of residence. Entire IWG team appealed students to swell with gratitude and allow it to overwhelm and thank those workers who uninterruptedly work serving 4 meals a day, for 7 days a week.

The idea being that benefit of expressing gratitude would surely go beyond a sense of self-worth, self-efficacy, and trust between the student community and those on whom student community is dependent as gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates the efforts made by entire IWG team to create a copacetic atmosphere in the campus.

short_message:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. All what matters is just that you don’t give up.”
Stephen Hawking
message:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. All what matters is just that you don’t give up.”
Stephen Hawking

A living embodiment of countless extraordinary traits. The Genius of the twenty first century, left us today. Dedicating his whole life to answering the biggest question humankind could impose on itself - “Where did it all begin?” and putting together the greatest theory of all times in the field - “The Big Bang theory”, he effortlessly outsmarted us all. Without a hint of pride, he made groundbreaking progress in the fields of his work. He gave us - The Brief History of Time and was most probably working on some super-intelligent theory to reveal many secrets when he finally departed to find the eternal truth behind it all.
May his soul rest in peace.

short_message: Science Education Group (SEG) in coordination with COSTISA (Coordination of Science and Technology Institutes’ Student Associations) invites you for a
message:
Science Education Group (SEG) in coordination with COSTISA (Coordination of Science and Technology Institutes’ Student Associations) invites you for a talk and discussion commemorating Shaheed Bhagat Singh.

Title: 'Bhagat Singh's Idea of Independent India'
Speaker: Prof. Jagmohan Singh (Human right activist, Nephew of Bhagat Singh and IIT Kgp Alumnus)
Date: 14th March, 2018
Time: 6PM
Venue: S. N. Bose Auditorium, IIT Kharagpur

Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/...

Abstract of the talk:
Shaheed Bhagat Singh - his vision of Free India and its relevance today. The talk will explore the making of Bhagat Singh in his family continuity of four generation of dedication to socio-political cause of people. There will be touching the development of Bhagat Singh's response to various social , economic and political problems of the time. How he analyzed and expressed himself on various contemporary movements. An in depth attempt will be understand how he prepared himself to be able to challenge the British Imperial rule and at the same time played a role of 'a vanguard of the broad national movement.' We will be understanding his practical approach in establishing youth movement which not only challenged the social basis but established a culture of freedom living. This will all based on his own writings and family information.

'Great are great because we are on our knees, let us arise. '

About the Speaker:
Prof. Jagmohan Singh, former Professor at Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, an alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, has been committed to dissemination of Bhagat Singh’s ideas. Son of Bhagat Singh’s sister Bibi Amar Kaur, Professor Jagmohan Singh has digitized most of the essential writings of Bhagat Singh. He is also the founding member of the Association For Democratic Rights (Punjab), the Jamhuri Adhikar Sabha which was formed in 1978. The association was conceived as a mass-based group to carry out a firsthand investigation of the reports of violation of human rights and put it in the public domain to help people’s movements in the fight for justice.

short_message: Nobody has any doubts over how convenient a bicycle is on the campus (no wonder we have so many psyclepaths* on the campus). Nevertheless, cycles have
message:
Nobody has any doubts over how convenient a bicycle is on the campus (no wonder we have so many psyclepaths* on the campus). Nevertheless, cycles have a reputation for being a pain in the neck. Cyclogists* at The Scholars' Avenue, after having done extensive research, present you, 'The Anatomy of a KGP Bicycle'. We request bikeaholics* to not get offended.

*psyclepaths = people who love cycles.
*bikeaholic = same as above.
*Cyclogists, ok, at this point, it is clear that we are just showing off our skill at pun making.

short_message:
Finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball

RK vs MMM1 (3-2): In the jam-packed Volleyball court, the final match
story: Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur is with Naidu Nani and 9 others.
message:
Finals || General Championship 2017-18 || Sports and Games || Volleyball

RK vs MMM1 (3-2): In the jam-packed Volleyball court, the final match was played between MMM1 and RK. RK dominated the first set, winning it by 25-14. But MMM1 was in no mood to bow down and made a great comeback by winning consecutive sets by 25-18, 27-25 respectively. RK bounced back in the game and won the 4th set by 25-22, setting up the final for an exciting finish. Both the teams fought with full energy but it was RK who came on top, winning the decider set by 15-9 and finally the match by 25-14, 18-25, 25-27, 25-22, 15-9.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates both the teams for putting up a brilliant show and the winning team for becoming the champions!

short_message: Most of us have had a teenage fantasy for machines, vehicles and technology, but hardly anyone fuels his fantasies in a way that Mr. Siddartha Khastgir,
message:
Most of us have had a teenage fantasy for machines, vehicles and technology, but hardly anyone fuels his fantasies in a way that Mr. Siddartha Khastgir, a KGP graduate who is now a globally recognized researcher, has done!
In this article of our series “Jewels of KGP”, we are delighted to present before you this young talent who transformed his boyhood love for hot wheels and formula one racing into building autonomous cars! While he was an undergraduate student of Mechanical Engineering in KGP, Siddartha took a giant leap for his passion of cars as he procured a funding of 1 Million from Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT KGP and founded Team KART-Formula SAE Team of IIT Kharagpur in his third year of engineering.
He currently pursues research at the University of Warwick in autonomous vehicles. Recently, he has also been named in the prestigious Forbes 30 Under 30 Europe 2018- Industry List for research contributions which have delivered impact to the automotive industry.
Awaaz got a chance to interact with Siddartha and this conversation gives a glimpse into the professional and personal life of this realistic optimist who has never believed in giving up!
http://awaaziitkgp.org/si...

message:
General Quiz and Biz Quiz | Quiz Week Day 5

Day 5 saw a very busy day with quizzes after quizzes going on at Vikramshila. General Quiz started early in the afternoon with people gathering being treated with a dose of everything in the world. After that, the Biz Quiz took place in the evening and saw a very topsy-turvy finale with the final spots getting chosen in the final few questions.

Results:
General Quiz:
First: Amit Kumar Ram, Agnimitra Anand, Pranav Joshi (260)
Second: Piyush Kedia, Rupam Kumar Dubey, Vaibhav Krishna (210)
Third: Kaustav Mandal, Kaniska Ghosh + 1 (205)

Biz Quiz:
First: Piyush Kedia, Kaustav Mandal, Anmol Joshi (270)
Second: Sourav Chirania, Harsha Vattem, Siddhant Ladha (240)
Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Anurag Mondal, Shubhra Agrawal (230)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners and wishes IIT KGP Quiz Club best of luck for the last day of the Quiz Week tomorrow.

short_message:
Women's Quiz | Quiz Week Day 3

Day 3, a veritable first for KGP quizzing in many ways saw a women-only quiz being conducted with 25 participants,
story: The Scholars' Avenue added 4 new photos — with Bindu Sancheti and Shweta Jaiswal.
message:
Women's Quiz | Quiz Week Day 3

Day 3, a veritable first for KGP quizzing in many ways saw a women-only quiz being conducted with 25 participants, which, compared to the norm of 2-3 women in regular quizzes was a huge improvement. It continued the trend of first-timers leaving right after prelims without waiting for the results for yet another day in a row where the third member of the (later on)first place team left, assuming she wouldn't qualify. Considering that almost all of the participants being first-time quizzers, the scores received in the prelims and finals results were very competitive.
The aim of the event had been to try and introduce women to the sport and the response, especially in the finals from teams was very positive, with blocks and enthusiastic hint requests and clarifications going around on questions. The finals boiled down to a tie-breaker for third place and after three further tie-breaker questions which couldn't break the tie, the third place remained tied till the end in the final result.
Prof. Seema Singh of the HSS department also graced the event with her presence and stayed almost till the end of the quiz.

First: Sangeeta Roy, Shubhra Agrawal (225)
Second: Ayushi Mrigen, Nikita Gautam, Kavana Rao (135)
Third: Shubhi Jain, Abhigna Revuru, Nayan Kubade (130) and
Pankhuri Saxena, Samruddhi Pataskar and Pankhudi Jain (130)
Fourth: (125)
Fifth: (120)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and hopes that this helps somewhat bridge the gender disparity in quizzing in the campus and further wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club best of luck for the future quizzes in this event.

short_message: This Women's Day, let's talk about one of the recent initiatives taken by a group of girls who came together and founded the IIT Kharagpur chapter of Lean
message:
This Women's Day, let's talk about one of the recent initiatives taken by a group of girls who came together and founded the IIT Kharagpur chapter of Lean In i.e., Lean In, IIT Kharagpur! They are a group of peers who meet weekly to share personal experiences, discuss weekly goals and provide professional support in a place of confidentiality and trust. They talk openly about their ambitions and encourage each other to take on new challenges. At a place like IIT Kharagpur, the skewed gender ratio results in a number of biases. By bringing a discussion about these biases, they want to help people, both men and women to fight against them.
Lean In Foundation is a nonprofit organization founded by Facebook COO Sheryl Sandberg in 2013 following the success of her book titled Lean In. The foundation is dedicated to offering women the ongoing inspiration and support to help them achieve their goals. Inspired by the success of other circles around the globe, they started a Lean In circle at IIT Kharagpur.
Give this a read: http://awaaziitkgp.org/le...

short_message:
India Quiz | Quiz Week: Day 2

Day 2 in the Intra-KGP Quiz Week saw an even higher participation from the KGP population, with similar scenes
story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
India Quiz | Quiz Week: Day 2

Day 2 in the Intra-KGP Quiz Week saw an even higher participation from the KGP population, with similar scenes occurring with first timers as day one. Another prelims participant had to miss out because of low self-confidence about his own talent because he left for his hall without leaving any contact info.
Both the prelims and finals were highly entertaining, with all the three podium places getting cleared out in the final three questions of the quiz with all the other teams chasing just 5-15 points behind.
The point of female participation came up again today, but this time, there was some participation from the female populace and one of them even making it to the finals.

First: Harsh Agarwal, Pinaki Mishra, Sourav Kundu (180)
Second: Sourav Chirania, Baibhab Pattnaik, Kaniska Ghosh (150)
Third: Satyam Agarwal, Pratik Gokul Zaware, Shreyans Sadangi (145)
Fourth, Fifth, Sixth: (140)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club all the best for today's Women Only Quiz.

short_message: Yet another proud moment for KGPians! Shri Vinay Kumar (IFS: 1992), an IIT KGP alumnus, has been appointed as India’s new ambassador to the Islamic Republic
message:
Yet another proud moment for KGPians! Shri Vinay Kumar (IFS: 1992), an IIT KGP alumnus, has been appointed as India’s new ambassador to the Islamic Republic Of Afghanistan. He is currently serving as Joint Secretary at the Ministry Of External Affairs in New Delhi and is expected to take up his assignment shortly. As said by the ministry, he has held various positions, including an assignment in India’s permanent mission to the United Nations.

On the behalf of entire KGP community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes him all the best for his tenure!

Source- http://mea.gov.in/press-r...

https://www.pajhwok.com/e...

short_message:
Sports Quiz | Quiz Week : Day 1

Today saw the participation of close to 70 people for the prelims and we saw the greatest fear of most non-quizzers
story: The Scholars' Avenue added 2 new photos.
message:
Sports Quiz | Quiz Week : Day 1

Today saw the participation of close to 70 people for the prelims and we saw the greatest fear of most non-quizzers coming up in action and tackled head-on.
Two people out of the 24 finalists scored higher than Quiz Club regulars and yet, because they thought they hadn't done well enough, left without even waiting for the results. One of them didn't submit their contact details so we couldn't even reach them to let them know and hence had to take the next highest scorer present. We later got to know that there were two-three people who didn't want to see if they could qualify and didn't submit their answer sheet for checking, where it turned out that they would've actually qualified for the finals. The team that won actually had a member like that, who after giving up, decided to go to his room, from where he had to be called to come back for the finals and eventually won. The finals itself was a cliffhanger with the podium places getting decided in the last two questions of the quiz.

Furthermore, there were no women in attendance. An event, that has no barriers to entry, and no prerequisites for taking part, as well as cash prizes and refreshments where non-regulars to QC sessions turned up and performed very well had an entire section of our campus population giving it a miss in participation definitely speaks volumes about this. We invite discussion regarding this in the comments section, and more than discussion, ideas to improve this situation, considering that Quiz Club has brought laurels for the institute in multiple places throughout the past years and their current Quiz Week initiative is an attempt to lure in people who don't consider themselves knowledgeable enough.

Final Results:

First: B. Pattnaik, Bhart Singh, Sougata Paul (135)
Second: Agnimitra Anand, Piyush Kedia, Hemansh Kashyap (120)
Third: Amit Kumar Ram, Rajat Jain, Kaushal Vadera (118)
Fourth Place: (115)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners and wishes Quiz Club all the best for the rest of the quizzes to be held as part of Quiz Week.
